thread_text:
Noticed there’s no longer an option to immediately clear funds (without waiting 2 weeks) for 1% fee.
Has this feature been removed or is it just a bug?
reply_text: It was placed as a temporary thing when Covid started becoming a major issue, so maybe Fiverr has decided that it has indeed run its course.

thread_text:
Noticed there’s no longer an option to immediately clear funds (without waiting 2 weeks) for 1% fee.
Has this feature been removed or is it just a bug?
reply_text: I just checked and still see the option. Do you by any chance have only revenues pending for orders that the buyers didn’t actively complete?

thread_text:
Noticed there’s no longer an option to immediately clear funds (without waiting 2 weeks) for 1% fee.
Has this feature been removed or is it just a bug?
reply_text:
Early payout feature is in beta and I think I just got it a few days ago, it wasn’t there a week back for me probably.
It seems by the looks of it that the speed up button shows only for orders that have been marked as complete by the buyer, not on all orders. If the buyer didn’t mark the order as complete, or if it was marked as complete automatically after 3 days without response from the buyer, then there is no option for early payout.

thread_name: Send Warning to Buyer If Order Disputed!
frequent_posters: dmaxstudio, uk1000, vibronx, olyasr, jake_hopkins, maxloskor, marinapomorac
thread_text:
I have noticed most of the buyer come on Fiverr and search many of gig and selected 3, 4 gigs that he like the most and place order to all four sellers. When four sellers are working on the same project, then three sellers are in lost because buyer only like one seller work and order of the other the three sellers are disputed, the buyer does this thing again and again.
Drawback:
When buyer doing this same this, again and again, Fiverr seller system is disturbed because three seller is in losses due to cancellation.
Fiverr face more inquires because after the order dispute everyone contact seller customer support.
I want to suggest Fiverr please implements a system to buyer account that he could not place one order too many sellers. Implement any system to buyer analytic how much buyer dispute the order and send a warning to the buyer if he is doing the same thing again and again.
reply_text:
dmaxstudio:
I want to suggest Fiverr please implements a system to buyer account that he could not place one order too many sellers.
Impossible to implement.
How can you prove he is going to cancel 3 extra orders? How are you going to prove he is not looking for samples and willing to pay all 4 and then give extra to the best designer?
Impossible.

thread_name: Send Warning to Buyer If Order Disputed!
frequent_posters: dmaxstudio, uk1000, vibronx, olyasr, jake_hopkins, maxloskor, marinapomorac
thread_text:
I have noticed most of the buyer come on Fiverr and search many of gig and selected 3, 4 gigs that he like the most and place order to all four sellers. When four sellers are working on the same project, then three sellers are in lost because buyer only like one seller work and order of the other the three sellers are disputed, the buyer does this thing again and again.
Drawback:
When buyer doing this same this, again and again, Fiverr seller system is disturbed because three seller is in losses due to cancellation.
Fiverr face more inquires because after the order dispute everyone contact seller customer support.
I want to suggest Fiverr please implements a system to buyer account that he could not place one order too many sellers. Implement any system to buyer analytic how much buyer dispute the order and send a warning to the buyer if he is doing the same thing again and again.
reply_text:
I am a frequent buyer on Fiverr, and when I place orders, I usually need to do at least a dozen at a time. Oftentimes within the same category. I am sure a lot of other buyers do the same. Why would Fiverr restrict buyers in this way? It would make their revenues drop immensely and also make the process more inconvenient for buyers. It would make many buyers switch to competitors.
And, I am sure my account would have been flagged last Summer then. I ordered from a lot of sellers who suddenly realized that they could not do what they promised after stringing me along for weeks or even months at a time, or who delivered incomplete work.
Yes, cancellations may hurt sellers more than buyers (analytics dropping, level demotions), and it may sometimes seem very unfair, but Fiverr cannot start flagging buyer accounts for simply ordering too much or for canceling (unless they break ToS, of course). That would hurt the marketplace and be a very bad business decision.
Also, do not forget that buyers are often hurt by cancellations as well, for example, by losing valuable time and profits.

If you delivered high quality work, communication was inside of Fiverr and you can prove, that the buyer really ordered from few different sellers, you can contact CS, but you don’t know, you just can’t know, that he is doing it.

I want to suggest Fiverr please implements a system to buyer account that he could not place one order too many sellers. Implement any system to buyer analytic how much buyer dispute the order and send a warning to the buyer if he is doing the same thing again and again.
reply_text: Okay but you could just show images with a big enough watermark on them before they order. There’s no need to send the .psd or AI files before they order (eg. png/jpeg could have been sent with the watermark). Also a rendering of the 3d model with a watermark overlayed could have been sent through the inbox if you wanted to show a sample (or maybe a few renderings of it from different viewpoints). There’s no need to send the actual 3d model before they order.

thread_name: Send Warning to Buyer If Order Disputed!
frequent_posters: dmaxstudio, uk1000, vibronx, olyasr, jake_hopkins, maxloskor, marinapomorac
thread_text:
I have noticed most of the buyer come on Fiverr and search many of gig and selected 3, 4 gigs that he like the most and place order to all four sellers. When four sellers are working on the same project, then three sellers are in lost because buyer only like one seller work and order of the other the three sellers are disputed, the buyer does this thing again and again.
Drawback:
When buyer doing this same this, again and again, Fiverr seller system is disturbed because three seller is in losses due to cancellation.
Fiverr face more inquires because after the order dispute everyone contact seller customer support.
I want to suggest Fiverr please implements a system to buyer account that he could not place one order too many sellers. Implement any system to buyer analytic how much buyer dispute the order and send a warning to the buyer if he is doing the same thing again and again.
reply_text: I also face this problem, after my order cancellation still now I’m not getting any order

thread_text:
We sell xactimate esx files. We have added them to the orders box and the customer cannot download them. Seems we are able to fill orders but your system doesn’t allow for us to complete within the parameters of the website. We basically have violate fiver rules by sending outside of your system to complete an order which I don’t feel comfortable with however, it’s the only way.
Please advise
reply_text:
arboristsite:
We basically have violate fiver rules by sending outside of your system to complete an order which I don’t feel comfortable with however, it’s the only way.
Violations of the rules usually end up with warnings or even worse… It’s not your fault if the buyer can’t download the files, you can always contact support if that happens and let them know about the issue.

reply_text:
There is no such thing as “rank” in the search results. Your gigs are not “ranked” on the last page. That’s just where you see them showing up right now.
If you want more orders, perhaps now is a good time to learn how to market and promote your services, on your own, to the target customers who need your services. Fiverr does not guarantee sales just because you have gigs on Fiverr, and they don’t guarantee that a seller’s gigs will show up in the search results where they/you want them to show up.
It is unwise to expect Fiverr to bring you all your sales, or to make you successful. That’s your job, and yes, it will require marketing, promotion, and not sitting back and waiting for things to happen. If things aren’t working out the way you want them to, try different things. Experiment until you find something that achieves the results you seek.

reply_text:
If the numbers were there in the place (eg. place in the database) the website code is using/used to retrieve them the values would show on the analytics page. But they don’t/didn’t. Before they changed the website code to show “N/A” for everything, the most recent few days were showing 0 for everyone. So the most recent days totals were getting either stored as 0 or null or not being stored at all in the place in the db the analytics page looks (reads) to show them, and still are likely not (otherwise they’d have removed the code that shows “N/A” in every field). So I don’t really think it’s just a “display issue”. ie. the more recent figures are wrong somewhere in the database (even if they’re right/stored in some other place).
So I’d say the correct daily totals for clicks etc. can’t be stored in the database currently for the days since it went wrong (started showing 0 for everyone). But it’s possible that there’s another table/file where the values needed to create those daily totals and that that is working okay (though it’s strange that it’s not been fixed so far).

He has his opinion that people should do things to try to improve their gigs and situation on their own. There is some merit in that. I realize people seem to be in a panic right now.

reply_text:
bodmas:
Please
@jonbaas
if you know you are not affected by this, just stop posting same thing on every topic about “Nothing wrong with algorithm” you are not part of support team or Fiverr staff…
I am affected by this – and have been many times over the past few years. This is nothing new, and it does not stop a good seller from being successful. I have learned how to work withing the system, and I have learned how to overcome the obstacles. I am trying to help other people think for themselves, and learn to overcome these obstacles as well.
Just because the loud voices, that like to complain, don’t want to listen, doesn’t make me wrong, or the facts untrue. This is nothing new. The algorithm is working, and it is normal for gigs to rotate – and yes, move to the last page from time to time. This has happened to me half a dozen times or more over the past few years, and my gigs have always rotated back over time.
Be patient, learn to adapt, and please stop complaining as if this is the end of the world. It isn’t.
Wisdom comes from listening and learning. Be wise and listen.

Regarding This issue got answer from fiverr CS … Hope will be helpfull for everybody.
We’re working on getting your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views back online. No worries - your Gigs are active, and all the metrics are calculated as usual.
Dan | Team Lead (Fiverr Customer Support)
May 14, 2020, 3:30:19 AM EDT
Hello there,
Thank you for reaching out. We’re currently experiencing a display issue with gig impressions, views and clicks. The numbers are still being calculated properly, and we’re working to resolve this issue. This is happening for all sellers on Fiverr.
Currently there is no estimated time of the resolution but rest assured that it’s in our best interest to resolve this as quickly as possible.
Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Nothing is any different now than it has been over the past few years. The search results are working exactly as Fiverr appears to intend them to work. There is no 50-70% of people affected. This it normal, this is the way things work on Fiverr. There is no need to try to find a reason, or something to blame, because NOTHING is wrong with the algorithm.
Just because you (or anyone else) claim there’s a problem, doesn’t mean there is. Just because your gigs (or those of others) have entered rotation, does NOT mean that something is broken.
Please stop blaming Fiverr, or the system, for your failure to adapt to normal changes.

reply_text:
Hi all! As you all I am facing the same issue. My gig was on the first page and now I can’t even find it in first 10 pages. No new clients no new messages. Then I messaged fiverr team and they told me my gig is totally fine. So I was really confused by not knowing what actually happened. Then I thought I should act positively.
If fiverr says they are working on it, surely they will be doing so. We have nothing to do with that. I don’t remember they waited us this much in the past few years. They might be facing some practical issues in this pandemic. That might be the reason for taking it this longer.
So these are the things I did
I update all my gigs again. Then I found out some gigs have lack of keywords and some have unwanted and wrong keywords
And I saw that fiverr has given a new place to put your “SEO TITLE”. Some of you might know about this already. If not, please go and update your SEO TITLE today.
Then I update the FAQ for many of my gigs. I hope it might help your client to understand your service much better.
Here is the most important thing. I saw my gig description works fine on desktop but not on mobile devices. Some of my gigs didn’t have spaces between paragraphs when it comes to mobile view. But it was totally fine in desktop view. We all know now everybody uses mobile. So this will have a real effect in your gigs.
Also, I take few fiverr tests related to my service. So I could verify few of my skills
And one last thing I did was, I spent a few bucks on “Learn from fiverr” tutorials related to my service to upgrade my skills. I must say these tutorials are Amazing. Specially tutorials from Mr. Daniel Walter Scott was excellent. I invite you to watch these tutorials and you will thank me one day. Also, you will get few badges at the end as a bonus and they will be displayed on your profile forever.
So these are the things I did in this bad situation. Because I thought doing something is better than waiting. Let’s hope for the best

You can share your experience or post an update on this in this thread.
Edit on :
June 2, 2020 (Dhaka)
We already have 500+ replies regarding this issue, Fiverr Dev Team working on it to fix. Unless Fiverr fixes the issue, there isn’t anything we can do. For now, the thread is closed for any new reply, For detailed information please read the entire thread, a lot of information/experience already shared here.
Edit: The issue is resolved.
If you still do not see the fix, please log out, try clearing cookies, and logging back in. If that still doesn’t work, please contact support with your information.
~ Read This.
reply_text: Kinda looking for alternatives now, most of them seem to suck, a month is too long for something like this, suggests a real problem here. I really didn’t need this right now and all the people saying “the problem is your marketing” etc are talking nonsense, plenty of high level sellers on here have said their normal routine with regards to work has changed significantly, i don’t know what to say. Upsetting, and kinda embarrassing for fiverr that this problem is still going on. Something else is up here.

reply_text:
nahuelamaya:
It’s been almost a month since I got this message. I had a decent flow of customers until that message appear.
As the message in the orange bar clearly indicates, your gig’s ability to gain metrics, and appearance in the search results have absolutely nothing to do with the display issue on your Gigs page.
The message clearly states:
“No worries - your Gigs are active, and all the metrics are calculated as usual.”
The display issue has nothing to do with the success or visibility of your gigs. Fiverr has literally said this, word for word. Please stop perpetuating false claims.

reply_text:
mattheweveringh:
They’re either lying or wrong, lots of high level sellers have noticed it, whether you like it or not it IS having an impact
Not lots compared to the total number of sellers on Fiverr. They’re just loud on the forum, but then again, you have a similar loud group every now and then. They blame the change in algorithm, the holidays, this change, that change… And sales come and go, no matter what, and it can happen to sellers of any level.
Many sellers are still getting sales (just look at all the topics about their first sale, their first $1000, whatever).
It’s pretty much the usual, with those who haven’t been getting sales lately now blaming the inability to see their metrics instead of blaming the algorithm, covid, Fiverr sabotaging them on purpose, or somebody’s dog.

mattheweveringh:
but you don’t know any better than anyone else
No, I don’t. What I do know is that I’m getting more sales than I did in April (or March, February, January…). And I’m not the only one.
mattheweveringh:
i know it’s odd people say they had dozens of messages daily or weekly and now have none
I don’t know for how long you’ve been on Fiverr forum, but every now and then, there is a number of sellers (not always the same sellers, of course) who complain about the exact same thing, and it’s been like that for years, when the problem with displaying metrics didn’t exist.
mattheweveringh:
I don’t see why all of these people are “a loud group” when some are top sellers.
I call them the loud group because there’s always a loud group complaining about not getting sales, and because they keep saying the same thing, you get the impression that their number is huge, even though there are sellers who keep getting sales (but they don’t come to the forum to repeatedly say that). And level has nothing to do with it, top sellers can suddenly stop getting sales, too.
Now the ones who are not getting sales are even louder than usual, probably because of the pandemic panic.

reply_text:
sameed_webdev:
It’s working for you Great. Isn’t working for many of Us That’s it.
I experience the same things all the loud voices are complaining about right now. I am not immune just because I am a Fiverr veteran. The search algorithm affects us all equally. The difference is, I work with the system, instead of complaining when it doesn’t do what I want or make me more visible than someone else. There are thousands of people who want to be on the first page of search results, but there isn’t room for them on that page. This is why the system rotates all gigs (based upon internal factors we do not need to know about).
If you are rotated “to the last page”, be patient, and you will likely be rotated back. This has happened to me many times over the past few years. Yes, it happens to me, and no, I am not complaining about it over and over here on the forums – like the current loud voices are.
This is how the search algorithm works.
sameed_webdev:
We aren’t getting any response from Buyers .
It is a terribly irresponsible concept to expect the Fiverr search system to work in your favor, and provide you with all of your orders. If you aren’t getting the kind of orders you want from the search system, then please take responsibility for your own success, and market and promote your gigs to your target customers – on your own – wherever they may be located. All businesses have to do this. Here on Fiverr, you are a businessman too, so I don’t understand why hard self-motivated work doesn’t apply to the loud voices here, on the forums?
Fiverr says the search system is working like it should. This clarification is clearly posted on everyone’s Gigs page. As Fiverr clearly states, the analytics display error has nothing to do with gigs being active, and functioning properly, within the search system.
sameed_webdev:
Kindly Take into consideration what others are going through.
I am well aware of the nature of the complaints being voiced here. Complaints, however, do not equal truth, especially when Fiverr has clearly spelled out the nature of the error (and it’s connection to anything else). Complaining about something that Fiverr says is not broken, is not going to result in the search system being changed to adhere to the demands being voiced here.
Please be patient. The analytics DISPLAY ERROR will be fixed when Fiverr fixes it.

reply_text:
vidvox:
more than 100+ Peoples Complaining on forum that There gig is not appearing on search
Please share your source for this number of people complaining. I’ve been around, here on the forums for years, and it doesn’t look like any more people now, than those who are usually complaining about this sort of thing in the past. The issue is a DISPLAY error. It has nothing to do with a gig’s ability to perform. As Fiverr states – clearly – on everyone’s Gigs page, all gigs are still gaining analytics, those analytics just aren’t being DISPLAYED. Gigs and the algorithm are working just fine.
vidvox:
Because Like me Many Other Peoples Follow Gig Analytics Page Because its Really Helps us a lot to check How Our Gigs are performing.
I don’t know. It sounds, to me, like many sellers are addicted to seeing stats, and they have come to believe that the stats guarantee them success. The analytics stats are just numbers. Success does not depend upon those numbers. Success depends upon the ACTIONS sellers take, and, as far as I’ve seen, most of the sellers complaining about the display error, are also the same sellers that aren’t taking any productive ACTIONS to become successful.
Analytics stats will not guarantee success. Sitting around and watching numbers rise and fall won’t result in profitable gigs. Stop staring at the numbers, and start doing research, promotion, marketing, experimentation, taking risks, etc.
You don’t to know your on-site impressions in order to build your business.

I am not asking about any guarantee to Rank up my gig on First page I am not asking about orders and I am not Asking anything from you or fiverr to help me to grow my business. I am on fiverr from 2 years.
Like Me Many Users, I also Used analytics page to See their progress and That’s How we see our gig performance and that’s how we Speed up our Marketing and sharing policies in order to gain good impressions and Get some Good Response From Buyer.
My Question is Very Simple . Like You and 2 Other Persons in this forum , You are Saying Stats are Useless and This is Just a Display Issue . I Mean If Stats Are Working then why Fiverr Taking so much time to Resolve a display Issue? Even a Person who build website for 50$ knows how to Resolve Display issues and Fiverrr a millionaire Company Does not know how to resolve display issue???
Surely its not a display issue its more than this that’s why a millionaire company is struggling from weeks to sort out. Our Demand is Simple Fiverr Has Given us a Option to Keep track of our gigs performance ad activity and Previously with that it was working fine. Now If That option is hurting many sellers like me its our Right to ask fiverr to resolve this issue. My argument is not with you and I Have not started this with you. But Your Opinion is wrong that its just a display issue.
Lastly Fiverr is Open for all its not mine or yours only property to work with. We work with sellers Give them Revisions and After a bunch of Hard work we get only 4$ , on the other hand without too much work fiverr take 3$ from per order . So then They should show some maturity , Have capacity of bearing New Customers and They should be able to sort out Bugs like this.

reply_text:
wolfhowler:
I think people are obsessed with their stats.
I think there’s a big difference between being ‘obsessed’ with stats, and ‘interested’ in stats, yet a lot of the responses I’ve read on this thread suggest that even having a passing interest in stats is foolish and a waste of time. I simply can’t wrap my head around that way of thinking.
Do you need stats to sell? No, of course not. Just like you don’t need money to be happy. But it helps, right? Stats help you to make decisions about your business based on actual metrics, as opposed to speculation.
The metrics in Fiverr are woefully bad as-is. I’d love to know what keywords drove buyers to our gigs. I’d love to know which demos buyers listened to - how many times on average a buyer visited our gig before buying etc etc… All of these are metrics we could be shown, whilst still maintaining buyer privacy, and they would give us actionable insight to make changes to our gigs with.
The fact that Fiverr can’t even give us the absolute basic stats, for almost a month now, is the reason why people, myself included, get frustrated.

reply_text:
wolfhowler:
Well you say why can’t Fiverr trust all sellers.
With respect, you’ve paraphrased me a little there. What I said was that most of us will do the right thing, and for those who don’t, punishments exist to discourage bad behaviour, and I was referring only to being able to see some basic metrics related only to our own gigs, not giving out my username and password to random strangers, which is why I said we’re not quite comparing the same thing.
For clarity, my two pence on this is that Fiverr could and should give us more, higher quality metrics to work with. As Fiverr grows and evolves as a business (now an NYSE listed company, not some tin-pot freelance site), and as we all grow as sellers, why can’t we understand a little more about customer behaviour behind the scenes, when it’s related to our own gigs? That’s evolution. Exploitation will always happen, that’s what sensible risk-mitigation, rules and punishments exist for.
That’s my opinion, nothing more, and I totally get and respect that a number of people disagree with me.

reply_text:
wolfhowler:
I’m not saying this is the right thing to do, I do agree statistics are important to help improve marketing and understand business needs. But possibly Fiverr has a different goal.
Absolutely agree with you. But something that I feel often gets missed in conversations, is that Fiverr has two sets of customers - the ones who buy the products, and the ones who pay the seller fees. We’re customers of Fiverr too, just a different type. It’s a cliche, but it’s true; without sellers there would be no Fiverr.
And for all the enormous improvements that buyers have seen in the way they interact with the Fiverr platform over the years, I feel that we as sellers haven’t seen quite the same level of improvements.
I’m hopeful that will change, and I’m excited about the Promoted Gigs feature that’s hopefully launching soon. It would make sense to bundle some new metrics in with that, so who knows?

reply_text:
jobtheilstrator:
Then why is that so many people complaining about it?Please stop saying it is not a problem…
People are complaining because they think the analytics display issue is related to a gigs activity in the search results and this is not true. Fiverr has said exactly this.
Those who are complaining merely because they cannot see their analytics (which are still being calculated, just not shown), have a valid complaint. Those who are complaining that they think their gigs are failing because of the analytics display issue, are merely wasting time. The two things are not related. By Fiverr’s own statement, the analytics display issue has nothing to do with gigs in the search system. I will continue to remind people that there is no search results problem, until Fiverr specifically says otherwise. I am expressing the truth, as we know it. It is not your place to demand that I do otherwise.

reply_text:
celebrawitch:
My point is that my sales have been really good since I started my fiverr account and they dropped at the same time Fiverr stopped showing gig impressions. Obviously I am going to think there is a correlation and so will others who are having that same issue.
And, obviously, based upon what Fiverr has said, that would be a wrong assumption.
celebrawitch:
If you aren’t having any problems and doing so well with your business, why do you have so much time to spend on the forums when the problem doesn’t even concern you?
I choose to be here, and I choose to dedicate some of my time each day to help others. I also stand against misinformation – as I have, on the forum, for years. Just because I am successful with my sales, does not mean I should stop interacting here. My continued hope is that there are people who ARE willing to listen to reason, wisdom, and my expert advice… and those who listen can become as successful as I, and other veteran sellers, have become.
In fact, over the years, many sellers have thanked me for sharing my advice and insight here on the forums. I am honored to have been a part of the success many other former new sellers are now experiencing. If YOU don’t want to listen, that’s fine… clearly you don’t want to be helped right now.
celebrawitch:
Perhaps you shouldn’t give unsolicited advice when you don’t even know someone’s situation.
That’s the thing, though, in large part, I DO know the situations of most who are complaining. I’ve been here for years, and I have seen just about everything. I have also experienced what the loud voices are complaining about, and I have learned from those experience. It would be wonderful it those who are complaining about things that aren’t even true, would stop and look at the situation objectively, and realize that what they are doing is expending needless energy that could be better invested in becoming better sellers.
celebrawitch:
I did not need your patronizing reply.
And I, respectfully, don’t need you to be telling me not to stand up for reason, and voice an alternate perspective of things. This is a discussion forum… a civil discourse. If you want to believe what isn’t true, that’s fine, but it is not appropriate for you to say that I cannot oppose that misinformation.
I’m here to help those who are willing to listen.

anytime I see your response on any post, I feel somehow…

reply_text:
Hi guys, I’m really sad of what’s happening right now and I am affected by this as well its been 3 months of my gig improving then suddenly it went down to 0 impressions on april 28 and I get no messages or orders after this bug, but we can stop arguing about this, I’ve asked one my top rated seller friend, he’s been on fiverr since 2012. I’ve asked him if its a natural rotation or really a bug, because the rotation happened at the same time the gig analytics went offline. I’m still in doubt but I trust my friend about this, he said there’s a time that our gig will be on the last page for maybe a month, but it’ll go back as it is, and fiverr will give you a chance to shine again. I hope this comment will help ease my fellow freelancers. and I hope we can get back to the track as soon as possible. Cheers to us! and Godbless to us all.
P.S FOR THOSE WHO WANTS TO HELP, HELP BY MAKING OUR FELLOW FREELANCERS FEEL AT EASE, NOT MAKE IT WORSE BY SAYING THEY’RE BAD IN ADVERTISING/PROMOTING!

reply_text:
marthacontents:
I have seen a gig with 1star review on the first page of a niche in Fiverr. First page with 1 star review and 1 order for weeks.
I have noticed a lot of new gigs on the first page now too. It’s impossible to figure out how gigs are rotated.
Clearly there is much more than gig analytics determining where gigs are placed. Because those gigs must have terrible analytics aside from massive impressions which who knows why they deserve that.
I’ve seen new gigs without orders which never get orders stay on the first page month after month for no reason I could see, then later the person became a top rated seller, so there are things which fiverr likes about a gig that have nothing to do with how many orders it gets, or how new it is.

reply_text:
I track the stats for the month after I’ve made changes to my gig, including sales. Increased stats tend to lead to increased sales, decreased stats tend to lead to decreased sales, obviously. While sales are the best metric, my gig is rather niche, so I don’t get them all that often; that being the case, the stats are a quicker metric of interest in my gig and allow me to fine tune prices and packages more rapidly.
More impressions = more interest = more sales.

I entered your title of your first gig into the search bar. Here are a few observations of the gigs on the first page:
Only 3 are level 2 sellers
Only 5 are level 1 sellers
6 are Pro sellers
the rest are level 0 sellers – that’s 31 sellers are level 0 on the first page
On the second page, 35 are level 0 sellers
There are 12,868 level 0 sellers and only about 4,200 level 1 and 2 combined.
So there are an overwhelming number of new sellers or level 0 sellers compared to the rest. If anyone’s gig comes up on the first or second page they have truly won the lottery.

reply_text:
I’m new to the Forum and created my first gig a few months ago. There are a lot of opinions about what is going on, so rather than sharing my opinion I’ll share my experience.
I originally saw my impressions drop to 0 randomly after having climbed up to around 90 a day beginning around the 28th of April.
I have had my most productive month-long period so far from halfway through April to about a week ago, with 27 orders overall and around 13 inquiries per day. I was getting so many orders that I marked myself as “out of office” for the better part of a week and a half to slow down. When I came back, my first day began with about 4 new inquiries and nothing else. Since then, I have received absolutely nothing, no messages or orders from new buyers (I’ve had two messages from returning buyers but no orders).
That is my experience. I’ve found my gig on the very last page of search results for about a week, so it’s searchable, but almost impossible to find.
As for my opinion, I want to believe it’s the system glitching but I’m just not sure. I heard there was a gig rotation around the same time so it might just be that. Nevertheless, I feel like an international company should be able to have fixed this glitch within a few days, let alone a month. Being new to Fiverr, I’m really not in much of a position to criticize, but I really hope this is a fluke and not how Fiverr normally operates, keeping us all in the dark like this.
If anyone more experienced has info on how Fiverr normally works it would be much appreciated! Have a great day/night everyone

Hello, you may have shot yourself in the foot by going out of office for a week and a half. I’m just guessing but that can sometimes lead to a slowdown in orders when you come back.
You also mentioned April 28 which seems to be about the time others report a slowdown. So it’s not possible to tell what happened in any particular case.

It’s a highly competitive site now. What the secret is to getting more impressions and visibility no one knows.

reply_text:
Hi Fiverr Team,
I am a bit confused by how you handle this issue. As you can imagine, displaying gig statistics is quite an important functionality for any fiverr seller on your platform. You even promote it as one of the basic functionalities of fiverr in your eLearning videos. And this is sure true as interpreting and reacting to gigs analytics data may have direct impact on the received orders.
Mistakes can happen and problems pop up every now and then in any company but I am left rather speechless how you handle this incident.
First, there is no transparent communication on this issue beside this orange box, which is telling the obvious, i.e. that the gigs statistics are not displayed and that you are working on it. But common, you have a blog, why not use it to communicate with your customers? Why are the gigs stats down? Have you been hacked? Did someone press delete accidentally? Did a server go down? How is the progress of fixing the issue so far? Anything?!
Instead people have to search through the forums for a thread, which is not even marked sticky, but people actually have to search for it. On top, the thread basically says the same as the orange box and is flooded by repeating questions of your customers. This is a pretty bad communication Fiverr team.
Moreover, asking in the forums, I was merely pointed to this thread, which doesn’t provide any information at all, instead of answering my questions, which are rather legit to most of us. On top, without having a chance to reply my thread was closed? Pretty strange way of addressing legit requests of your customers.
I hope you can use this current challenge to heavily improve the way you communicate incidents with your customers.
Happy to receive your feedback.
Cheers,
André

@andreschaller
That’s a nice note. Well written. However, it seems to me thinking as if I were part of the management team on fiverr, that it’s not a good idea to share secrets or the internal workings of what is always going on. Fiverr is a publicly held company. How the site is run is a subject that is not to be made public. Internal decisions on any changes to the site are not going to be announced.
We sellers have to work with the changes that come along and do the best we can.
As far as I know, the fiverr team does not read posts here most of the time.
What if those stats are being eliminated? What if they are being changed in a big way? They can’t tell us in advance. They have a large company on the stock exchange here. Any sort of advance announcements like that could affect stock shares, either good or bad.

Hi
@misscrystal
,
thanks! Actually, it is not about sharing secrets at all. it is about communication. Incident response and incident response communication are standard processes of any company. It is not a binary decision to either publicly disclose non-secret data or not disclose anything because internal processes might be affected. In both cases, transparent communication is key.
I am not saying that the public should decide how the side is run. It is really just about communicating issues that affect the platform as a whole to its customers. I think this is a basic process for any company like mentioned above.
Best,
André

reply_text:
Thanks for further looking into the situation. I’m in complete agreeance with you. As a Level 2 Seller with 200+ reviews on this specific gig alone, it doesn’t seem logical (or fair but we won’t go into that) that “randomly” my Best Selling gig would lose it’s search authority to instead preference gigs with limited credibility.
I read one post that possibly they’ve skewed the algorithm to favor new Sellers amidst the COVID-19 crisis? While in a way I understand the logic, I too spent nearly a year putting my blood, sweat and tears into creating something sustainable out of this gig - proving my capabilities, commitment to customer service, etc.
If this is an intentional shift in the algorithm, it is disappointing that Fiverr would do wrong by loyal Sellers, who too are struggling through this humanitarian and economic crisis. May I ask if this is an issue you might recommend inquiring further with customer service about? I’ve tried politely, but receive a blanket response re: display issue. Thanks again for your time.

reply_text:
I feel I need to share something positive in this bad mood topic.
I don't know what's happening, but I like it
Your Fiverr Experience
I am a 15 year old web developer, I started my Fiverr account in March and I got my first order 1 week later. Until May I got an order every ~2 weeks, which was still good for me. But this month something happened. My orders skyrocketed. I get at least 4 messages a day. Most of them buy my gig and I’ve been able to raise my prices. In May until now I earned about 200$. It’s become quite overwhelming and I had to pause my gigs until I get the current active orders done. All in all, I’m very glad …

@vidvox
The thing about this forum is that it’s normal for people to have different opinions. That does NOT mean you get to insult them or talk badly about them if you don’t agree with them.
I don’t need to come here and try to explain things to people. I don’t get paid for this. I do it because of the misguided idea that people like you might learn something. What do I get out of this discussion? Nothing at all.

WAA WAA WAAAAAH my gigs arent’ showing, I’m not getting orders, it’s from the statistics not showing when will it be fixed WAAAHHHH!

reply_text:
Thanks so much for the compliment!
Honestly, I rarely change it, and I know that causes me to drop back in rankings. When I do though, it’s important for me to see how that affects changes in the long run as, like I said, my gig is niche. I understood that going in. The only thing I can use to evaluate the interest (note that I’m not saying success) is in analytics, as my sales aren’t frequent enough to give good data.
I wonder if this whole argument is just the difference in perspectives. For those who have a steady stream of sales, the analytics page is essentially useless. You know sales are going to come in and your gig is running like a well-oiled machine; what’s the point of checking impressions, then?
For those who don’t expect many sales (like me), the analytics data actually serve a role as they’re an important indicator of interest. I only get a few sales a month, which I’m fine with, so I need to rely on other indicators for gig performance. They’re not perfect, but it generally helps me predict if a sale is coming or if my ads on other sites are actually driving traffic to my gig.
Of course, there are plenty of new recruits who are using analytics as a source of hope, and that’s where a lot of problems come up, as they’re not entirely reliable and don’t guarantee anything.

@markadamsdesign
Your discussion makes sense. You have such a unique gig. I assume most here have gigs that are more traditional.
My theory is that if your gigs can have a way to stand out somehow from the rest in a good way then you won’t need the analytics, for those who are in a highly competitive group of sellers. That way might simply be having outstanding talent.
If a seller has been plodding along with bad graphics and a gig that doesn’t stand out somehow from the rest and getting impressions and sales they’ve been very lucky. That might be changing now that half the world’s population has suddenly decided to become sellers on fiverr.

reply_text:
tommybmedia:
I haven’t gotten any orders in the past 2 weeks and it would be incredibly useful to see if there was a drop in impressions or the same amount of impressions, just nobody is inquiring (which I could use to adjust my gig accordingly.)
I would hazard a guess that your impressions have gone way down if you stopped getting orders, if you regularly got orders before.
I can tell where my gig is located approximately and how many impressions it gets by how many messages and orders I get.
Impressions are not the whole story since you can get a lot of very low quality impressions, where your gig is actually being displayed, but not in a place anyone is looking for it to buy it.
It’s always possible that you can have lots of impressions without any sales if your gig is shown only to a certain demographic, certain country, certain out of the way place, where it is assured it won’t get sales.
We all would like our gigs to be shown mostly in one or two countries known to represent the most buyers but it’s possible to have it displayed where no one ever wants it also. Fiverr is good at showing impressions where it’s not going to get many sales sometimes as part of it’s rotation.
Fiverr can also slow down sales for you in spite of a lot of impressions by putting the gigs of your competition right on your own gig page.

reply_text:
That was most likely your 60 day average rating. If you hadn’t had any ratings in the last 60 days it would have no ratings to base that 60 day average on so would show “N/A”. After you had a new rating it would base it on that rating and show that as the average, which is why it now shows something there.
Fiverr hasn’t changed anything there. It’s not related to the “N/A” showing in the gig stats for everyone.

reply_text:
You took the words right out of my mouth. With these replies, I could swear that there are 2-3 people getting paid to calm people down because of the panic this bug is creating.
As I said earlier, the gigs stopped rotating and you might be lucky to be on the first or second page when it stopped. However, there are people stuck on the last page.
I receive atleast two messages on Fiverr everyday and ever since this bug started, I have received 0. 0. I have like 5 friends on Fiverr that the same has happened to. Either their gigs disappeared to the last page or they can’t even find their gigs anymore. On the other hand , you will find gigs with 1 star reviews , 2 star reviews on the first page. And these gigs have been on the first page for weeks now. That would never happen if everything was normal.
Yes you’re lucky, your gigs are working fine because the platform collapsed when you were on the first page or so, but you can’t use your own privileges to downplay what everyone else is going through. That makes no sense at all.
As it has been said repeatedly here, if it was a just a display issue, Fiverr would have solved it in a day. IT IS WAY MORE THAN THAT. The N/A bug has messed up the algorithm but Fiverr won’t tell us that because that will make them lose people.
Waking up to see replies dismissing everyone’s claims as “illogical” or just replying with “Fiverr has already said it doesn’t affect so it doesn’t ” make me sick.

reply_text:
My gig used to receive 3-4 orders with 80-100 views everyday, a few months back Fiverr even contacted me to help them with creating a whole new category since I was and still am one of the top sellers within the Tattoo Design category.
Ever since the gig analytics crashed I have had a maximum of 4 clicks on my gig per day and I have gotten an eighth of the orders that I usually get.
I understand that this is not a large amount of people and I am not asking for any type of special treatment. I would just like to add to the obvious evidence that can be found in the forum already.
I have worked extremely hard to gain momentum on this platform, just like many other sellers here that are experiencing the same problem. The customer support service needs to address this problem and give their sellers the respect that they deserve.

That’s a one dimensional way of looking at the subject with all of the evidence that I provided.
I could’ve easily just told you that there’s a large amount of people who aren’t having much of a financial problem through this pandemic.
We are also speaking of online traffic, I think it is more than fair to say that it should be much higher since most people are in their homes throughout the pandemic.
Many countries have also opened tattoo shops, my country included. Which would suggest more online traffic.
Lastly, there are multiple people with the same problem. They are not all in the Tattoo Design category.
The problem I see within this thread is that there are people with serious issues on their gig and the people that aren’t experiencing it are the first to call it out as something that isn’t true.
There is obviously a larger issue at hand.

thread_name: Fiverr team please solve the buyers problem
frequent_posters: rana4944, merohan, coerdelion, hedayetsaadi556, gina_riley2, johnnyguillerm, dmaxstudio, jack_jack088, prapty_rh, kyrsten_sinema, carolallsopp, usamaathar368, sarmin_123, share_thought, nafishasan, digital_99_ways, pvitalsolutions, logo_avenue, mtpdesigners
thread_text:
Hi,
There are a lot of hassles in buyer request options!
After posting the request, more than 100 sellers bid on the request…
The number of sellers does not understand what the buyers really need. But they bid because the bid is free.
The buyer leaves the Fiverr after this behavior of fake or spam sellers.
I give solution to Fiverr team. Please review this system and improve it like Upwork.
Get .50 cents from buyer who post the request, and get at-least .30 to .40 cents from seller who bid on it.
After that we can control the spam sellers and find some talented persons.
I appeal to Fiverr team, please take action and improve your plate-forum for buyer and seller.
Thanks
reply_text: I agree with you.

After that we can control the spam sellers and find some talented persons.
I appeal to Fiverr team, please take action and improve your plate-forum for buyer and seller.
Thanks

merohan:

reply_text:
Thin end of the wedge.
I can see why people might think this a good idea,but the truth is that the reason Fiverr is as popular as it is, is that it’s so easy to use, free both to post a buyer request and respond to it … and Fiverr’s business model isn’t about competing with downverk or any of the others
At the moment things are a mess because of the pandemic … but my feeling is the spam buyer requests need a “report” button … and new sellers need to learn from people who know and care about them, rather than “gurus” on youtube.
Newbies need to think for themselves, learn and approach their Fiverr careers more professionally.
That would be far more useful than putting barriers in their way with no explanation as to why …
… other than, y’no, they’re annoying …

thread_text: There should be an option in Fiverr to call client or buyer via Fiverr Web Portal or App. Sometimes it really become difficult to understand in text what client wants to say. The thing which may take a minute on call takes an hour via chat resulting in time loss and poor customer experience
reply_text:
Fiverr didn’t provide seller with this options.
If Seller has this Video/ Voice options, Fiverr can’t check whether or not seller / client ask their contact id / number.
So If you really need this, there are other different platform suitable for this…,

thread_text: There should be an option in Fiverr to call client or buyer via Fiverr Web Portal or App. Sometimes it really become difficult to understand in text what client wants to say. The thing which may take a minute on call takes an hour via chat resulting in time loss and poor customer experience
reply_text:
This has already been discussed many times. For example, you can see a lot of responses in this recent thread. I doubt opinions have changed a lot since then:
Should there be a voice calling option on fiverr?
Fiverr Site
So, I would like to ask my fellow sellers, would they like it seeing a calling option (both video and normal calls) apart from fiverr chat to communicate with their customers. According to me, chats are less engaging (however, everyone has their own perspective of seeing things), if me and my client decide mutually, that we can have a quick call instead of chatting which will save time too (Personally, I don’t like writing long texts to clients explaining them how my process works) It is easie…

thread_name: Problem with fiverr search after vacation mode
thread_text:
Hi everybody,
I’m a level 1 seller, I got many orders last week, so I have activated vacation mode to focus on them. But when I disabled it, my gigs dont appear in fiverr searches, it has been 24 hours since I disabled it and it’s always the same problem. I have 25 completed order with 5 stars review. I hope that someone could help me. Thank you.
reply_text: In my experience when you go on vacation mode your orders will slow down for awhile. It took a week for mine to come back.

thread_name: Problem with fiverr search after vacation mode
thread_text:
Hi everybody,
I’m a level 1 seller, I got many orders last week, so I have activated vacation mode to focus on them. But when I disabled it, my gigs dont appear in fiverr searches, it has been 24 hours since I disabled it and it’s always the same problem. I have 25 completed order with 5 stars review. I hope that someone could help me. Thank you.
reply_text:
Vacation? What’s a vacation? Does the world look like it’s run by Carebears? I Fiverr even when I’m having open heart surgery.
More seriously, maybe think about just pausing gigs next time. Vacation mode should really be renamed “life emergency/ not sure I’ll ever be back/ the Feds finally found me mode.”
I have have used vacation mode in the distant past and I did notice a huge drop after deactivating it. Pausing gigs during peak busy times, though, seems to go under the radar of the Fiverr search gremlins.

Usually when I don’t know what something is and need a quick explanation, I look for a lucid/viewable video on youtube. Maybe saddle up your marketing horse and create a well tagged “What is Matlab?” video on Youtube and Dtube and put a few links pointing back to your gig.
When in order oblivion, market your way out.
Edit: Also increasing prices seems to get the Fiverr searches attention.

I use the vacation mode about 10 days per month and didn’t notice any problem but some sellers say that the vacation mode affect their gig.
One of my gig had completely disappeared since january. I sent a screenshot of the gig views stats to CS and they did I don’t know what (they didn’t explain!). The day after their mysterious action I received an order.
You should send CS a screenshot of the views stats.

thread_name: Problem with fiverr search after vacation mode
thread_text:
Hi everybody,
I’m a level 1 seller, I got many orders last week, so I have activated vacation mode to focus on them. But when I disabled it, my gigs dont appear in fiverr searches, it has been 24 hours since I disabled it and it’s always the same problem. I have 25 completed order with 5 stars review. I hope that someone could help me. Thank you.
reply_text:
jadjazi:
I can’t find my gig in any of all the pages with the keyword “Matlab”. It was never below the sixth line in first page
One issue might be is that you offer to do Matlab assignments. Fiverr ToS not to do school work for students. The ToS state that homework is a:
Third party TOS violation - By taking part in doing someone else’s academic work (which will likely be submitted as the student’s own work) you are actively taking part in a violation of the integrity code of most, if not all, schools and academic institutions. This behavior can lead to the suspension or expulsion of students. Fiverr does not allow taking part in such fraudulent activities.
You are in danger of not only losing the gig, but your account if you continue to sell this service.

thread_text:
Hello, I am trying to block a buyer from previous bad experience, but i noticed i can’t do it anymore and the buyers can still contact me. And i don’t want this because if i cancel an order from the same buyer in the future, my rating goes down.
https://sellers.fiverr.com/en/article/blocking-certain-buyers 2
What can i do?
Thanks,
Tommy
reply_text:
tommysiu:
https://sellers.fiverr.com/en/article/blocking-certain-buyers
Your linked page has the answer.
To block a buyer:
From the buyer’s user profile page, click Block .
Select a reason from the list, and then click Submit.
Note: This feature is not yet available to all sellers.

thread_text: Have somebody noticed that when you logged in to the Fiverr account, you show as online while the green light right top at the profile is greyed-out. Is this only happening to my account or you guys have also the same issue? Tried to went offline and then online from setting but didn’t work.
reply_text:
I used to have the same problem, until I started doing this:
Online Status not showing?
Report a Bug
I also experienced that for a long time, but after a while I noticed that Fiverr shows two different log in “pages”: [Online status - log in] Whenever I log in with page #1, my gigs never shows up as online, but if I log in with page #2, after some minutes it switches on. So when page #1 is presented, I just restart the browser until I’m presented with #2.

thread_name: Known issues with the Skill Tests provided by ExpertRating
thread_text:
Continuing discussions from Take a Test, Earn Trust! 1 and My first impression of the Skills Test feature 3
What are Skill Tests and what do they do?
If you’ve explored the options on your profile, you may have found the Skill Tests. These currently have no active benefit to Sellers unless a Buyer specifically looks for them. Relevant results cannot be placed in gigs and they can only be seen in the Seller’s profile.
Who is ExpertRating?
ExpertRating is considered a course provider and certification issuer based in India.
Their homepage states:
Leaders in Online Certification
Have your skills certified through the same platform used by Walmart, Google, IKEA, Ericsson, GAP and Amazon.
The main problem for us on Fiverr
Certification places should have standards, especially online. (Google search results for “ExpertRating reviews” avg. 4.5 of 5.)
With so many different people taking the tests just for the sake of taking it (like here on Fiverr) it’s difficult to impossible to even review questions with low ‘right answer’ rates. So they rely on a ‘tell us if anything is wrong’ section at the end of the test. The problem with that is remembering exactly what was wrong with exactly which question. And forget it if there’s problems on more than one question. I’m sure there are people who can remember such details under normal circumstances, but under the timed pressure of taking a test? That is not the best environment for stimulating memory of issues with the test itself.
In trying to report issues, I’ve tried copying the section of text (didn’t work) and taking a screenshot of an error question (I couldn’t refer to the screenshot without leaving the window, which automatically failed me, even after the test was ‘ended’). I understand why you can’t copy text in the tests, but that leads to the aforementioned issue about memory and reporting.
Collection of noted issues
(Some of these issues are more prevalent than others.)
No correct answer
Identical answers
Poor grammar/spelling/punctuation
Outdated questions/answers (which places an additional negative of easier cheating)
Disconnections leading to automatic failures
Missing images (where the question prompts to refer to such)
Minor:
No randomization for layout or order in retakes.
Textbook-answer questions.
The test offers ‘multiple-possible answers’ option. Underutilized. (test: skill vs knowledge)
Potential fix?
I firmly think people shouldn’t complain about issues without offering a possible solution. So here is one that I think should be in the realm of possibility to easily implement. (I’ll admit: I’m not a programmer, so I don’t know how difficult it would actually be to code.)
There should be a way to flag a question from within the test itself. Even if it doesn’t allow an explanation, and (really) especially since you don’t want to take time from the test itself to fill something out, if the same question gets flagged by enough test-takers, it could/should be more closely looked at by the test ‘proctors’.
Dear Fiverr,
Please connect with ExpertRating about this. For the sake of Buyers, Sellers, and your own reputation. You promote professionalism. You are a platform of such great opportunities, but contracting out your tests to a questionable third-party is not helping.
reply_text:
Good idea. I agree there should be some way of flagging bad questions on the tests so they can be fixed (like suggested, Fiverr should be able to send that info/data back to the skill test providers). Hopefully that would fix the current tests or speed up fixing of them.
I agree quite a few/many of the tests are outdated and they could do with new tests for new topics (as well as updating any existing tests so they’re still up to date) or tests based on open source software or lower priced software in addition to the current tests. eg. one test requires very high priced software when questions using an open source alternative could be done instead for the same topic.
I assumed there was some randomisation in the tests but if there isn’t, doing that would help stop cheating.

uk1000:
I agree quite a few/many of the tests are outdated and they could do with new tests for new topics (as well as updating any existing tests so they’re still up to date) or tests based on open source software or lower priced software in addition to the current tests. eg. one test requires very high priced software when questions using an open source alternative could be done instead for the same topic.
I can see where you’re coming from. While it would be impossible to have tests for all the possible software for every genre of gig, some tests for the more popular free/open programs could be built.
Though, on further thought, those high-priced program licencors might have paid the ExpertRating ‘school’ to make tests for those programs. I know colleges have contracts/licences/accreditation to teach using certain textbooks/software/standards. This can be good, in cases like standards for GAAP or making sure students have a minimum knowledge of Microsoft Office programs. In contrast, I can recall making due with GIMP when I had Photoshop assignments (ran out of time in the library, finished at home), and basic Wordpad when the assignment was suppose to be done in aforementioned Office (built the basic assignment at home, finished at school).

The “content authenticity” bit is just to cover themselves in case they got sued. Even though there are errors/omissions in the test that haven’t been fixed, as well the fact that they are not fully up to date.

That is not the best environment for stimulating memory of issues with the test itself.
In trying to report issues, I’ve tried copying the section of text (didn’t work) and taking a screenshot of an error question (I couldn’t refer to the screenshot without leaving the window, which automatically failed me, even after the test was ‘ended’). I understand why you can’t copy text in the tests, but that leads to the aforementioned issue about memory and reporting.
Collection of noted issues
(Some of these issues are more prevalent than others.)
No correct answer
Identical answers
Poor grammar/spelling/punctuation
Outdated questions/answers (which places an additional negative of easier cheating)
Disconnections leading to automatic failures
Missing images (where the question prompts to refer to such)
Minor:
No randomization for layout or order in retakes.
Textbook-answer questions.
The test offers ‘multiple-possible answers’ option. Underutilized. (test: skill vs knowledge)
Potential fix?
I firmly think people shouldn’t complain about issues without offering a possible solution. So here is one that I think should be in the realm of possibility to easily implement. (I’ll admit: I’m not a programmer, so I don’t know how difficult it would actually be to code.)
There should be a way to flag a question from within the test itself. Even if it doesn’t allow an explanation, and (really) especially since you don’t want to take time from the test itself to fill something out, if the same question gets flagged by enough test-takers, it could/should be more closely looked at by the test ‘proctors’.
Dear Fiverr,
Please connect with ExpertRating about this. For the sake of Buyers, Sellers, and your own reputation. You promote professionalism. You are a platform of such great opportunities, but contracting out your tests to a questionable third-party is not helping.
reply_text: They should consider using Interview Mocha if they really want to test people. Their tests are actually written to be understood by people and everything makes sense.

thread_name: Control of Orders - Seller now targeting me for revenge
frequent_posters: geo5er, lenasemenkova, markhallva, genuineguidance, vicvera450, gwyneth_galvin, nafishasan, bumblepixco, wordpressn
thread_text:
Another reason why we sellers need some form of control on what orders to accept and not.
As a buyer I ordered a gig, the seller oversold himself and could not deliver. He had said he will make up and handle the 2nd phase so I did not cancel order on him, so he can make up for it on a subsequent task that apparently was more capable of. Only to also not deliver on this 2nd task, by means of not even responding. He actually requested a refund via CS and I did receive the funds back.
Before the refund was processed, I posted a review, as it was my responsibility to share my experience with others as this is the whole purpose of reviews.
Obviously he did not like the review and had also asked me to not post a review while he handles the refund.
After refund, he asked me to speak to CS to have the review removed.
I ignored him.
So what does he do now? He places an order on one of my low cost gigs to only do the same as ‘revenge’ and also give me a low rating and affect my overall 5-star.
I have no plans to accept or deliver this gig or even message him, and I think Fiverr should handle such via some processes so it does not affect my ranking, but for goodness sake, we need some control of which gigs to accept and not to be able to handle such orders from such people.
(note: this was a gig that I actually wanted to remove but not got around to it. When I received notification new order pending requirements, I managed to delete this gig before buyer was able to complete the requirements. Still he was able to submit the requirements and submit the order and countdown commence. Maybe helpful for others to know what happens in such cases)
He asking me to remove his review and now harassing me this way, should his account not be at risk of closure?
and if due to my case, he does get his account removed, he will most likely attack me from another account and try to do the same. Hence why and another reason we need to curate and accept or decline orders as needed and even filters to not accept new buyers and to be able to see details about this new buyer especially when they are under a new account.
Wanted to hear what others have to suggest and how to handle it, besides contacting CS.
ignore the order and not deliver, and how will that affect my profile?
other tips?
I am level 2, so hope I do indeed receive some priority support from CS team, only time will tell.
My experience and my 2cents worth why we need that ‘more order control’ option Fiverr.
Thank you
reply_text:
What a childish person.
You can’t remove reviews yourself - only CS can do this, and they will only do it if it breaks ToS.
If that seller told you that they placed the order to threaten you, definitely report them to CS. Include a screenshot of the exact message they sent. Hopefully they cancel the order for you.

reply_text:
The only thing you can do is compile all your evidence on this person (messages etc), especially where they are asking you to remove your review - as that is against the TOS and contact CS to see if they can cancel this order without it affecting your completion rate.
Unfortunately, if this person is that vengeful, they can create as many accounts as they like and order from you only to harm your reputation here - we do not have a tool that lets us cancel because we have a bad feeling about an order unfortunately. You may want to raise your prices so that it discourages them from ordering I suppose, but, you are in a pickle if they want to mess with you.
GG

I ignored him.
So what does he do now? He places an order on one of my low cost gigs to only do the same as ‘revenge’ and also give me a low rating and affect my overall 5-star.
I have no plans to accept or deliver this gig or even message him, and I think Fiverr should handle such via some processes so it does not affect my ranking, but for goodness sake, we need some control of which gigs to accept and not to be able to handle such orders from such people.
(note: this was a gig that I actually wanted to remove but not got around to it. When I received notification new order pending requirements, I managed to delete this gig before buyer was able to complete the requirements. Still he was able to submit the requirements and submit the order and countdown commence. Maybe helpful for others to know what happens in such cases)
He asking me to remove his review and now harassing me this way, should his account not be at risk of closure?
and if due to my case, he does get his account removed, he will most likely attack me from another account and try to do the same. Hence why and another reason we need to curate and accept or decline orders as needed and even filters to not accept new buyers and to be able to see details about this new buyer especially when they are under a new account.
Wanted to hear what others have to suggest and how to handle it, besides contacting CS.
ignore the order and not deliver, and how will that affect my profile?
other tips?
I am level 2, so hope I do indeed receive some priority support from CS team, only time will tell.
My experience and my 2cents worth why we need that ‘more order control’ option Fiverr.
Thank you
reply_text: Thats what you would expect from a type of person that doesnt follow through, twice. Then acts like a spoiled brat when you’re honest. Thats the world as we know it. Good luck, but don’t quit being honest! I think you will be helped out on this one. Let us know how it turns out!

Hello Everyone of You, I am wondering if it is based on your country. I am from Guyana and i have been directing thousands of individuals towards fiverr.
I only recently had complaints from many persons about the same issues.
#1 the area code for Guyana is 592 fiverr currently has 595
This would make it impossible for them to verify…
The next thing is more scary
#2 Every time someone complains about it the disable the account.
This is a very unfair business practice…
It is called discrimination…
Very Sad that fiverr a company that for the last three years I have sent so many persons too is doing this to the persons that help build their network. Which btw is getting very slow as of late.
I am hoping that they fix this issue as I will start redirecting persons from my network which now has over 200,000 people in it. most of which are Freelancers on the international market place.
FIX IT Please as it will be viewed as discrimination against third world countries. Thank You…

reply_text: N/A

thread_name: Fiverr “Verify Now” Mobile verification button is not working
thread_text: I make new account on fiverr create new gig at the finish of the gig it show me verify now button to verify via mobile but button is not working when i click on it it di nothing please solve this issue
reply_text:
On mobile if you using chrome. Click the menu setting (three dots @top right)
Then click request desktop site
And thats it

thread_name: Fiverr “Verify Now” Mobile verification button is not working
thread_text: I make new account on fiverr create new gig at the finish of the gig it show me verify now button to verify via mobile but button is not working when i click on it it di nothing please solve this issue
reply_text:
On an Android phone. No PC. Had to add and Manage Addresses in order to input number code, but submit button was still greyed out, on Chrome and Firefox (mobile and desktop versions of site).
Finally installed Hackers Keyboard. Opened from Google Play Store, Enabled, Restarted phone, Switched to the Hackers Keyboard.
I was able to just input the code with the normal numbers on the keyboard, and the submit button turned bright blue; pressed the button and was able to save my now verified number.

thread_name: I have problem in uploading gig
thread_text: i have already passed the english test in fiverr .i want to create a cresume creating gig,but whenever i uploading they ask me to complete the test …whats this mean…totaly confused.and the retake option is not working plz reply me …
reply_text:
there are two english tests, are you sure you have taken the correct one?
And if you have failed it you have to wait for 1 day to take it again but be careful because you are only allowed two tries in a 3 month window.
Hope this helps.

thread_name: Adding Skrill as an option for withdrawing money
thread_text:
Hi there,
First of all, I’ve seen some posts about it and sorry for the new topic, but they were dead since summer, so I thought best to create another one.
Paypal isn’t available in some countries, and Payoneer takes a lot of fees while withdrawing money from ATMs (talking from experience as I’ve used it for almost 3 years now). Bank transfer not an option as well.
Skrill is one of the best payment methods out there. I’ve used it for some of my work in the past, and I’ve connected it with my bank account here in my country and it has very very small fees. It really has helped me avoid some of the large fees Payoneer has.
If somebody from staff sees this post then should we make a poll or something to make this happen? Let us know please.
Armend
reply_text: N/A

thread_text: I had typed a really well thought out and long description for my gig, and it had less characters than the limit, but when I clicked save and continue for the requirements section, it took me back to the description page and deleted all my description! It just said I had to do less than 1200 characters, when I definitely had! This has happened twice now, and it’s really upsetting me because it took me ages to write those descriptions.
reply_text: I don’t know the answer, you might need to ask Customer Support. What I can advise is to always copy what you write anything long on the internet. Paste it into a text editor before hitting submit or save or send. It’s a critical best practice online. Good luck.

reply_text: Thank you! I appreciate any help, and definitely in the future, I will always save any long work to my computer. Thanks again, much appreciated!

reply_text:
Same to me. Apparently it happens when you edit the description after posting. If you don’t want to cut your text, write everything perfectly and don’t change it later. If you do change it, you’ll have to rewrite the all thing after.
As fonthaunt said, always save your texts in your pc or Drive. I hope they fix this, as it has been 4 years apparently…

thread_text: I’ve been doing everything from my Dashboard since I started. Then 2 weeks ago after my last job the Dashboard suddenly looked different. I didn’t put much thought into it because I had no jobs and thought maybe it’s different because there are no jobs. Well I got no jobs all of last week, which is odd. I have a new job today but the Dashboard is still different. It used to have the jobs on the top on the right. Now everything goes across the whole page. I eventually found the new job at the very bottom. Does anyone know what happened and is there a way I can go back to how it used to look? Thanks for any help.
reply_text:
Hello, I noticed nobody has replied, So I will try to help answer your questions.
They’re making changes to fiverr almost daily. You won’t see all of the changes as some arent visible to us frontenders. But it sounds like you’re referring to one of their recent dashboard updates.
Unfortunately, there’s no way to go back. They won’t change it up like that often, so try and get used to the new arrangements, Its likely here to stay for awhile.
I have logged on and then felt the need to double check the sites fingerprint because of the drastic change that happened overnight…but It’s normal for sites like fiverr as they have to adapt to the ever growing community, and sometimes you have to move things around to make everything fit. =P

thread_text:
As you can see in the following image, the character limit for Frequently Asked Question answers is not 300. It will allow a maximum of 299 characters.
This isn’t a major issue, but it’s worth mentioning.
reply_text: I noticed the issue because I was writing up some FAQs and fortunately reached the supposed limit.

thread_text:
As you can see in the following image, the character limit for Frequently Asked Question answers is not 300. It will allow a maximum of 299 characters.
This isn’t a major issue, but it’s worth mentioning.

thread_text:
Hi guys. I’m trying to set up a new seller account however I cannot proceed as I cannot reach the 65% completion rate for two reasons. I do not use any social media accounts (and do not ever wish to use them) therefor cannot link those. Furthermore an old Fiverr account was started with my Facebook account which is now deleted. My mobile phone number is connected to the old Fiverr account which prevents me from using my number with the new account.
I can no longer access the old account as my FB profile no longer exists so the account is kind of stuck in no man’s land where I can’t access it to delete/un-associate my phone number with it.
Any ways I can proceed with this or should I just give up on this platform?
Cheers,
Josh
reply_text:
Hello, Josh,
You can contact customer Service at support@fiverr.com.
They should be able to help you. However, keep in mind that due to the pandemic the are taking up to 10 days to reply.

thread_text:
Greetings,
I’m a freelancer on Fiverr.com 1 providing web development gigs. So far, whenever I send the delivery to the buyer, there is no sort of protection at all. There are mutliple ways to solve this.
Preview Only:
One way in which this could be solvable is creating a “Preview Only” whenever you deliver html files. Now I have no idea if this is possible for other files like .php, but usually this is how it works with market places for website themes and such. You can only preview it, and usually the code is hidden even in inspect it can be hidden in a lot of ways. The only way is if you buy the theme that you actually receive it by email.
The Idea:
My idea does not mean that the buyer has to receive the work via his/her email address. My idea is that the buyer can preview his/her new website, but only through Fiverr’s preview system. Which would obviously have a watermark also at the top that says “Delivery Preview”. The buyer can see the new website, and then if he/she likes it and clicks on “Accept Final Delivery”, a new option will popup that says “Download Source Files”, but only after accepting the final delivery. This can be one of many protection methods.
The Problem & Solution:
Another problem is after the delivery has been accepted. The buyer could just request a refund before the seller gets paid, which is a really big issue. Now the solution to this could be that instead of making a review “Optional” what about making it required? Just at least stars, no need for a certain message, just rating the buyer using stars shall be enough or just a Like/Dislike button, then that shall not allow the buyer to request a refund. This may be very unfair, but lets say that there was a problem after the delivery, a problem with code or a certain optimization and responsiveness. Perhaps the buyer can return to the order and request a “Technical Support”, which then wouldn’t cancel the order, it will notify the seller that there was an issue with the order. That would allow an easy solution to it.
What is your opinion on this idea? Do you guys have any other ideas that could be a solution to it?
This is just a personal opinion and an idea.
reply_text:
otractic:
Now the solution to this could be that instead of making a review “Optional” what about making it required?
Making any review required is not acceptable. Nowhere is a review something that is required.
It’s not an issue for a buyer to ask for a refund as long as you can refuse.
