reply_text:
Let me add some thoughts from my side here as well. I’ve been here on Fiverr as well for more than 6 years now. And I know very well how things work here on Fiverr.
Gig rotation is a normal thing but what is happening to gigs nowadays is not normal as throwing all gigs from first pages to 3rd last pages for no reason makes no sense at all. If you are not performing well and your gigs are not in search results and going downward in ranking that makes sense and is understandable.
And yeah, Like
@bodmas
said, how can you say everything is fine?
bodmas:
You claim nothing is wrong with the algorithm… If anything is faulty with the algorithm, would you know? Or would you be informed by the Fiverr staff?
They said 50 sellers but I can bet more than 100 sellers who have been on Fiverr are facing the same issue.
My gigs were on very first pages as I worked on them and then suddenly they are now on 3rd last pages of search since December 2019 for no reason at all and that too when I search after applying 2-3 filters (Country and Seller Level).
If just a few numbers of people are complaining about a thing that means the issue is with just a few sellers and that must be from the seller side. But when a large number of sellers are complaining about this same issue then Fiverr at least should give a clue of what is happening and what to do in such a case.
It is going to be 6th month now that my gigs aren’t getting sales from any new buyer (thanks to some old buyers who keep coming).
And one more thing to mention here: Those sellers who are facing this issue, when they make a new gig, that too lands on the last pages where other gigs are. I’ve tried and tested that.

thread_name: Gig is not in search result after bug on gig page?

I am on first my 2 gig rank on first page but after this bug "We’re working on getting your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views back online. " my all gig are not seen on search result i check up to 10 pages my gig not show?
Does anyone help me?
reply_text:
maxahir:
But when a large number of sellers are complaining about this same issue then Fiverr at least should give a clue of what is happening and what to do in such a case.
Fiverr is not going to release details on how the Fiverr search algorithm works, because the algorithm is proprietary software. It is not for public knowledge, because if it were, sellers would be able to manipulate the system in their favor. That would hurt Fiverr, and it would hurt what makes Fiverr the competitive services platform that it is.
I sympathize with you and others who don’t have the search visibility that you want, but Fiverr has said – many times – that the system is working as it is supposed to. If you ask them personally (via a message to CS), they’ll likely tell you exactly that. Fiverr does not guarantee search visibility to anyone. They’ve said this too. Therefore, there is no sense in complaining about something that is working properly, just because it isn’t working in your favor. Gig rotation is part of Fiverr’s chosen business model and operations policies. To ensure a fair market system, Fiverr has coded their algorithm to rotate. No one is guaranteed prime placement on the first place, no matter how long you’ve been on Fiverr, or how worthy you may feel that you are.
The algorithm mixes things up based upon factors we will never know. That is how Fiverr has designed it, and that is likely how it will remain. If your gig is not showing up where you want it to, then now might be a good time to start learning how to market and promote your gigs on your own. It is not Fiverr’s job to make sure you have orders. YOU are the freelancer offering your services here. YOU need to treat your gigs like a business, and, as any good businessman knows, marketing your own services to the people who need them is how business works.
The search system should NEVER be your only source of sales.

reply_text:
From my experience here, you all are absolutely correct. There is an issue with Fiverr’s algorithm that even CS is a little CLUELESS about or unfortunately as the case may be, CS may have been instructed to pacify all Sellers pending when a fix may be made (more like a system maintenance script). This actually started in August, 2019 following the launch of the Fiverr Pro Service. A lot of trial and error tactics disrupted the free flow of Fiverr. Before now, Fiverr Best Seller search worked on purely merit and rotation algorithm (Market forces of demand/supply, performance metrics) but now the search page works on irregular and irrational metrics. Before I deducted that in order to encourage the patronage of Fiverr Pro Sellers, all other senior sellers had to be hidden from the search page (taken to the last page) so that new buyers will find it extremely difficult to find them and end up patronizing the Fiverr Pro Sellers as against buying from inexperienced new sellers with 1 to 10 ratings. Unfortunately, Fiverr’s revenue is expected to drop going by my economics as a business plan writer that quantity not only brings many more buyers to Fiverr who will consistently patronize the platform thereby encouraging a free flow of revenue but also jobs and free advertisement for Fiverr that Quality that brings in onetime high paying clients once in a while with the delivery not being far better than the regular senior sellers whom have been tested and trusted on Fiverr through their reputation build up.
Over all, everyone should relax. Let the market forces play. Get your complaints recorded with CS as I believe there are metrics Fiverr management staff use to judge current problems of their marketplace. If we do not get jobs, Fiverr revenue will drop and there will be a comparison or evaluation on the success or failure of their new algorithm compared to the older and more efficient algorithm. Whatever happens, just like Instagram, Facebook and other Social Medias, Fiverr only gives you the platform to sell your service (you do not need to own your websites) get your customers from whatever means possible and prove to them you are a professional via your Fiverr page, record the sales on Fiverr and grow your public image worldwide.

It is only when one’s gigs are thrown to the last pages that is when they realize that the last pages exist. Overall Fiverr is still the best freelancing platform.

We didn’t build a search engine entirely from scratch, but we’re leveraging solar
and elastic and using them in a way that is slightly different than other companies

reply_text: It took me about three months to get my first gig, and even then I only made 5 dollars. You may need patience to work on fiverr, because once things take speed, you might be overwhelmed. Just make sure your profile and gigs are well presented, appreciate that there are those who came before you and went through the same feeling, understand that no one trusts your work yet then be patient. Don’t even delete your account, just move on as you wait for your first order. You will then discover the professional side of fiverr, make some awesome colleagues and get your chums. Practice patience, all will be well, assuming you are really great at your job

reply_text:
single gig impression
Do you know what impressions are?
In order for this to be possible, your gig must be inactive. Impressions are just when your gig shows up on a page in search. People don’t have to click on your gig for you to gain an impression.
I cant post a buyer request
Buyer requests are for buyers to post their projects, which sellers then respond to offering their services. You can’t post a new request unless you’re in ‘buying’ mode. There is a button specifically for switching modes and it’s at the top of every Fiverr page when you’re logged in.
Also, you never did answer how exactly you got scammed. Fiverr accounts are free to make and use.

reply_text:
Three of your four gigs rely on 100% accurate English language.
While your written English is actually very good, it is also far from native - which is what you claim in your profile.
You will therefore find that true native English speakers / writers are unlikely to use you as they can see and sense that something isn’t quite right.
Also, and I don’t necessarily agree with this although it is reality, anyone looking for an English based skill is likely to turn to US and British sellers.
Therefore the problem isn’t with Fiverr as a platform. The problem, I would suggest, is that your gigs aren’t quite up to the standard required for the services you are advertising.
It’s very easy to blame someone else. But it’s often wiser to look closer to home for the answer.

reply_text:
Ok all, I might have a solution. (EDIT: This only works if you have everything you need to set up the gig in one sitting. You CANNOT go back and edit a partially-complete gig - see moments at bottom.) This morning I went in as usual and nothing worked. But then I tried this, and I have been able to get to page 3 of setting up a new voiceover gig:
use Chrome
clear cache
set up a new gig (don’t try editing an old one)
try saving a few times on page 1 to trigger error messages on mandatory fields
on page 2, do the same - save when you first arrive on the page and all the fields should turn red - then start filling only those in (saving occasionally) - I was finally able to go to page 3
From page 3, I could then go back to page 2 and add the optional gig extras, etc, and save successfully.
Good luck everyone. (And if anyone in IT is monitoring this, please fix this bug!)
UPDATE***
Once you leave the gig set-up process, you can’t get past page 2 again if you return to edit your gig. I was almost through the process (page 6) and saved it and exited. Now I can’t get past page 2, so wasted all that time. FART!!!

thread_name: Cannot create gig without education and certification
thread_text:
Are education and certification mandatory? I got to page 4 while setting my professional info and since I don’t have any university/college education or certificates I left those fields empty. after I click on ‘Continue and create your first gig’ it pops up with this message

Are those fields required? I looked around some of the sellers’ accounts and they don’t have education or certifications, so something must be wrong here.
All help appreciated
reply_text: It’s a new feature that was added (can’t remember when). The profile has to be at least 65% complete. You will likely have to fill in the education section; even if it’s education from high school.

thread_name: Search Option to find specific seller by name
frequent_posters: balacafa, eoinfinnegan, dance2live, jonbaas, misscrystal, ahecd1, offlinehelpers, jor002, syedsamarhussai, vincentdiaz, ahmedtonmoy, zaiba202, qhuarez, ahmwritingco, miiila, mam_786, uk1000
thread_text:
Searching for seller name - I have tried to find a known seller by typing in their name and have never received a result.
It is much too long to search only by gig. I also doubt fiverr really has all these correctly categorized!??
Ie, second level seller for logo and specific language does not show my searched for seller.
Why do I need this? Because I use different accounts for different companies and therefore discover one designer through my other account and wish to find the same seller for my second account. Sorry to say I never found them. Also fiverr forbids contacting directly…so how the he… do I reach them?
Thanks for your consideration…
reply_text:
You’re only supposed to have one account, whether buyer or seller - in which case you’d find it easier to keep all your required sellers handy in your favourites.
You should be able to search by seller name, and you should also be able to filter by language etc.
If you’re struggling with any of the search/filter facilities, you can contact CS to ask for help - good luck!

thread_name: Search Option to find specific seller by name
frequent_posters: balacafa, eoinfinnegan, dance2live, jonbaas, misscrystal, ahecd1, offlinehelpers, jor002, syedsamarhussai, vincentdiaz, ahmedtonmoy, zaiba202, qhuarez, ahmwritingco, miiila, mam_786, uk1000
thread_text:
Searching for seller name - I have tried to find a known seller by typing in their name and have never received a result.
It is much too long to search only by gig. I also doubt fiverr really has all these correctly categorized!??
Ie, second level seller for logo and specific language does not show my searched for seller.
Why do I need this? Because I use different accounts for different companies and therefore discover one designer through my other account and wish to find the same seller for my second account. Sorry to say I never found them. Also fiverr forbids contacting directly…so how the he… do I reach them?
Thanks for your consideration…
reply_text:
The team account feature is supposed to be used by groups, organizations or businesses where there is one bill payer account but other people using the funds. So for example, if I wanted to have a secretary who was able to order Fiverr gigs on my behalf but didnt want to give him my credit card or paypal access, I would add their Fiverr account into my team so they can use the set limit of funds I allow and nothing more.
It is not for a buyer to have multiple accounts.

thread_text:
Hi,
Apologies if this has been suggested before, though I can’t find it, but I was wondering whether it might be a cool/helpful feature to let us make a custom signature template that automatically applies to our messages to buyers/sellers? I’m thinking it could work like it does on Outlook, where you can have multiple different signatures and then choose which one to apply in your message as default.
It wouldn’t be a groundbreaking feature - it’d just save me having to manually type “Kind regards, David” at the end of every single message. And yes, I get that I don’t have to leave a signature, but I like to do it to keep an air of professionalism with my messages, so being able to have one automatically apply would just save me maybe 5 seconds of my life with each message. And I mean each message - not just new/first enquiries.
It would also be handy if you could make multiple templates/signatures depending on, for example, if you were going on holiday. Like, if you were on holiday but still responding to messages on the app (to keep your response rate up) it’d save you a lot of time and hassle if you didn’t have to type something to the effect of “Please be aware I am currently on holiday between the x of y and the x of y so I am unable to take on any extra work, but I will get back to you blah blah blah” every single time you get a new message. Or if it was around Christmas you could have a Christmas specific one.
Or idk - am I the only one who puts a signature at the end of each message and thinks it’d be handy? That said, I’m aware that the “quick response” feature exists, it’d just be handy as a separate feature. Maybe.
reply_text:

thread_name: Suggestion: Change how the Average Response Time is calculated/displayed
thread_text:
The current way the average response time for sellers is calculated/shown is not all that fair to all countries (eg. those in a very different timezone to where the majority of buyers are) and not all that informative to potential buyers since the avg. response time shown (eg. to buyers) takes no account of the time of day/timezone.
A problem with it as it is is that a seller in a country in a timezone very different to that where the country/countries with the most buyers are could end up with quite a high response time if it’s sent out of the seller’s normal working hours (eg. 1 or 3 AM their time). Especially if multiple messages are sent around then and few from potential buyers in their own timezone recently. A high response time could then lead to fewer orders/messages sent to that seller, including from people from their own country/close timezone (eg. the average response time shown could be a lot higher than the actual response time if that potential buyer seeing it sent a message).
What might make the response time fairer for sellers is to make any messages outside normal hours for the seller (eg. Normal office hours) be excluded from the response time calculation (like someone thought it used to be), as well as to show that to the buyer somewhere.
Store Multiple Average Response Times for each Seller option
Another option would be to store multiple average response times – ones for different times during the day. eg. Split the 24 hour day into about 4 periods (so 4 six hour periods), and store an average response time for each of the 6 hour periods, eg. 00:00 to 06:00 for 1st average, 06:00:01 to 12:00 for second avg etc. There could be more periods (averages) stored if more accuracy was required. It could still be based on the last 60 days (or it could be changed to eg. 90 days if there were not enough messages in each of the 6 hour periods).
Doing it the above way could show a more accurate average (or expected) response time to the potential buyer based on the current time at the seller’s location. If there are times with a quicker average response time than the current one, maybe it could indicate that to the buyer on the seller’s profile or when you hover over the response time/click on it or click to send a message.
reply_text: You said very well, I agree with you, we should talk about this

thread_text:
I am what you can call a Fiverr veteran and havea lot of incomplete orders from 8 years ago or so. With the new changes Fiverr made, when I open the dashboard of course, by default “All Orders” are selected to display.
And that sounds good, but instead I am flooded with all those incomplete orders from years ago




If I select the Active Orders, then the Late and In Revision orders are not there. So It is leaving me with no other option but to NOT use the dashboard, but to see all sales in the Manage Sales area, when you sort them by Priority it gives you all orders: Late, Active, In Revision, etc. It is not ideal because it doesn’t give you an hourly deadline if you have more than 24 hours to deliver, but it will have to do for now.
I am sure that Fiverr is willing on making the Dashboard better, but unfortunately this is a rather step back and it only causes confusion to people who have a large number of incomplete orders from years ago, like me. So I really hope that a solution will be implemented so that we as well can benefit from it.
Regards,
Nace
reply_text: We’re in the same boat , I also have many incomplete orders … some of them are even from 2013. I discussed this with support a few years ago and they tried to cancel a few to see if they still affect my stats and unfortunately they do affect your stats if you ask support to cancel them… Until now there is no solution for this… but hopefully there’s going to be one in the future.

reply_text:
There’s this article (where the system might have changed since it was a few years ago):
https://sellers.fiverr.com/en/article/order-status 1
In the Incomplete section it says:
Note: After a week has passed from the original date of the order creation, a seller can cancel the order without any harm to their cancellation ratio or ratings.
So you could try cancelling one that is years old and see if it affects the stats (eg. wait until after it cancels or preferably a day after that - if the stats are only updated once a day) - you could try that if cancelling one order won’t have too much effect on your stats (but it shouldn’t have any I think). If it doesn’t affect it you could cancel others that are also old enough (eg. any > a week old and in the “incomplete” status might be okay to cancel now).
So cancelling them could then make viewing the dashboard easier to see the actual active (new) orders without a change to the dashboard.

thread_text:
I am what you can call a Fiverr veteran and havea lot of incomplete orders from 8 years ago or so. With the new changes Fiverr made, when I open the dashboard of course, by default “All Orders” are selected to display.
And that sounds good, but instead I am flooded with all those incomplete orders from years ago




If I select the Active Orders, then the Late and In Revision orders are not there. So It is leaving me with no other option but to NOT use the dashboard, but to see all sales in the Manage Sales area, when you sort them by Priority it gives you all orders: Late, Active, In Revision, etc. It is not ideal because it doesn’t give you an hourly deadline if you have more than 24 hours to deliver, but it will have to do for now.
I am sure that Fiverr is willing on making the Dashboard better, but unfortunately this is a rather step back and it only causes confusion to people who have a large number of incomplete orders from years ago, like me. So I really hope that a solution will be implemented so that we as well can benefit from it.
Regards,
Nace
reply_text: Thanks, I have quite a few to cancel, there is a ton of them. I will see what the support says before doing anything.

thread_name: 5-star review job funds refunded or cleared funds disappearing
thread_text: Anyone else have their incoming revenues from a job where the buyer accepts the work and gives you a 5-star review have fiverr cancel the job and refund the money without any notification? thread_name: Won’t accept my professional headshot for profile image
thread_text:

reply_text:
Welcome to the Fiverr forums.
We here are only buyers and sellers and you would need to file a ticket to Customer Support to communicate with Fiverr. They are also very behind right now.
Would you consider adding a light background? Maybe something related to your category might look nice, like a server bank or a chart with graph bars?

In laptop when i click on that notification it’s appear like this- 1st image
After scanning the code by mobile i get a link for verification -2nd image
After scan the QR code can’t get further option on laptop for verification so using my phone i enter in link where ID/passport /Driving license need to submit- 3rd image

thread_text: Recently I have been getting problems with the push notifications, when i turn them on it works but when i close the app they automatically get turned off again, i also tried reinstalling the app but that also does not seem to work. My response rate has gone down from 100% to 89%
reply_text:
Which phone do you have?
If you have Huawei android Mobile, then follow these steps to solve your problem.
1- Go to settings of your phone
2- Go to Power Management
3- In Power management, go to Protected Apps
4- On protected apps, go to the Fiverr and enabled the Fiverr as a Protected app.
Open your Fiverr account on Desktop/laptop: -
1- Go to the Settings, by clicking on the profile picture present at the upper right corner of your Fiverr.
2- Go to notifications.
3- Tick all check boxes

thread_text: Recently I have been getting problems with the push notifications, when i turn them on it works but when i close the app they automatically get turned off again, i also tried reinstalling the app but that also does not seem to work. My response rate has gone down from 100% to 89%
reply_text: I have a iphone, I can try doing those steps for iphone

thread_name: I submitted my Passport!, but my account now got disabled! (RESOLVED)
thread_text:
Hello everyone ,
i need help on regaining access to my account ,
a week ago fiverr requested that i upload a valid ( id , driving license or a passport ) to continue selling and buying, i uploaded my id along with a selfie of me ,
i got a ( we couldn’t verify your id ) , and for my country there was only option for a passport , also i didn’t have a passport at that time so 4 days ago i applied for a passport which i received today,
I scanned my passport in very HQ and took a selfie then i submitted them , when i refreshed i got that we couldn’t verify your id , that’s why i submitted them again !, i immediately got restricted and my account was temporarily disabled , ( i think it’s because i upload my passport twice )
can some fiverr CS help me !
i opened a ticket but the CS didn’t respond to it !
Thanks
reply_text: I had such problem even. Ask a photographer to take your picture passport size and a picture of your id card if possible not the passport, then it will work. Same thing happened with me and i did what i told above. It will recovered if you pass the verification. It tried the way i did and it worked, you can also try it might work.

reply_text:
Welcome to the Fiverr forum.
This is (sadly) a known issue. Recommend you use a separate document or use notepad on your computer and copy-paste into the description, or copy it out of the description into a doc before progressing. (Consider doing the same for the FAQs and Requirements section.)

thread_text: It appears as though the character count on the FAQ section, when in the editor, displays only as the amount that appears within the description and disregards the title. However, the title characters are still added to the whole amount and thusly the character amount will always be off by the amount stored within the title.

thread_text:
I’ve noticed some odd things going on with the Fiverr search ever since the analytics bug happened.
Right now if I search my category and sort by best selling. On top of the page gigs with literally 0 sales show up. While I and I and other top rated sellers have a lot more sales per day/week.
Also if I sort by relevance a lot of not well performing gig show up. This could be a choice to help out new sellers, but still seems a bit odd.
I think something with the best selling tab is definitely not going well.
Are they trying to give new sellers a better shot or is this a real bug?
Personally I don’t mind that much, because I have a lot of returning customers, build over the years, but it’s a bit hard to find new customers now.
Would love to hear your experiences.
Happy selling everyone!
reply_text:
Same here! All my “first-page” gigs are not appearing again. That happens also last week for 2-3 days.
Right now I am working with my stable customer and its near to impossible to find new ones.
Looks like they are making a lot of changes on the entire platform so I think that we have to wait for it.

thread_name: Gig Multiples for Packages - option to turn off/limit multiples needed
thread_text:
I had switched from the ‘normal’ 1 Gig thing to the Packages.
My packages offer, e. g. 100, 250 or 1000 words, but people can just use the gig multiple thing to up the words to several hundreds or thousands, while the delivery time stays the same,
and obviously I can only translate a certain number of words per day, no matter how long I work.
Please implement an option to limit the multiples, or at least the delivery time must go up with the number of multiples booked.
Being able to limit the bookable multiples I think would make the switch easier for a lot of people who are still not using packages too, it´s what kept me from switching earlier. I don´t want to have to cancel orders because people book more than I can do, and the simple option to turn off or limit the multiples would take care of that.
reply_text:
Dear Miiila:
Have you considered adding a gig multiples gig extra to your gig packages?
Make a special offer for that on Fiverr Anywhere!
Good luck,
Blaise

reply_text:
Dear Blaise,
the problem I face is that with the gig packages and the multiples people can book for example 50K words and the delivery time won´t go up and I´d have to deliver within 7 days, which would be a bit inconvenient…
People don´t read, and they can God knows how many gig multiples, I stopped trying how high I could go when I was over 100.
Will adding gig multiples as extras prevent that the multiples can be clicked? I’ll try and do that then, I´m still not sure why I shouldn´t be allowed to limit the multiples for my gigs, but if that´s a workaround I´ll take it!
Thank you.
Mila
edit: I don´t think it helps, I might have to go back to the non package set-up, there I could control this ‘issue’ with the extras, as I then could set additional time for additional words.
Hm, this doesn´t work with my package set-up, the extras are for all 3 packages, can´t make them different per package. Okay, I fear that means back to the one gig set-up, or take the risk of having to cancel orders.

Dear Miila:
I’m sorry, I was just joking.
I was making fun of the fact that Fiverr has added on so many different ways to do things, that it’s gotten a bit confusing.
I agree with you 100% that Fiverr needs to address your issue, and I suggest you add it to this thread:
Fiverrcast Questions
I also forgot to mention that maybe you should add that to your FAQ and to your pdfs.*
Mea culpa,
Blaise

P.S. You could also ask M where the Fiverrcast transcripts are, given that they were supposed to be back up by the weekend…

thread_name: Gig Multiples for Packages - option to turn off/limit multiples needed
thread_text:
I had switched from the ‘normal’ 1 Gig thing to the Packages.
My packages offer, e. g. 100, 250 or 1000 words, but people can just use the gig multiple thing to up the words to several hundreds or thousands, while the delivery time stays the same,
and obviously I can only translate a certain number of words per day, no matter how long I work.

reply_text:
Dear Blaise,
I see, thanks anyway, it was worth a try, because I had found a way around uncontrollable gig multiplication by clicking against my written pleas with the non-package set-up that way, alas, well.
FAQs and PDF is in theory a good idea, but the thing is I have on all 3 packages, where everyone who´d click any of them would have to see it, to please read the gig description, where this point is addressed, and I fear 1.) people who don´t read the description, won´t read a PDF either, and 2.) don´t really want to put PDFs up because the poor people who would read, have to read more then, and while certainly good and needed for some gigs.
And I had more FAQs, but already deleted some of them a while ago, because the more there are, the less the chance that they get read, especially by the buyers who should read them, a lot of buyers message anyway of course if they have big work like ebooks, but, well, sometimes when I´m already booked out and yet wouldn´t have to pause a gig because I could take on small jobs, only not bigger ones, there´s that risk,and a lot is not all…
I also don´t think most of my gigs/offers need a big explanation, those that need ‘talking’ need talking anyhow more than a PDF (I´m wondering about restructuring my gigs/splitting/specialising them more though and for that maybe the PDF approach will be good to keep in mind).
I did change the overlay text on my gig images also to that effect, in the hope some people who don´t read the desctiption will look at the pics, maybe I´ll try to work on that and the wording of the gig description to make it clearer, but, well, the simple ‘limit allowed gig multiples’ would make this a lot easier and DAU-safe too.
Thanks for the joking though and the suggestions, I´ll mull over it all and in either case I´ll add my question there and ask for the transcripts at that opportunity too!
Have a great Sunday,
Mila

reply_text:
Okay… bumping this because the counting of mutually cancelled orders for our completion rate just made this all the more important.
I had 2 cancellations now within short time because a buyer accidentally ordered a much higher gig multiple than they needed. So obviously they asked for a cancellation to reorder the right amount.
If i could choose how many gig multiples were possible to select with my gig, these 2 accidental orders and cancellations wouldn’t have happened, because for high word-counts which usually only would happen by mistake without inbox message and only ever happen per custom order really in my case, a buyer will have to contact me either way to make sure I even can do the order in the required time frame. There is absolutely no need and sense for my gigs to be able to be chosen in multiples like 10 or 20 or 50 or even more.
The only thing that can come of that option are cancellations because either a buyer clicks 10x the amount they want by accident or because a buyer would order something like 20K or 200K words without talking to me first and I might have to cancel it depending on my schedule.
Please let us sellers decide how many multiples of a gig a buyer can book ourselves, or at least give us a choice like 1-10 /1-20…unlimited, so it doesn’t unduly put those of us at a disadvantage who offer unique and custom and time intensive gigs.
There’s a huge difference in what amount you can deliver depending on the gig. I could probably send out 100 or even 1000 premade or mainly premade things like a PDF or a postcard from wherever within 3 days, but there’s a limit to how many words I can translate in 3 days, no matter how much coffee I drink and how little i sleep.
Thank you.

In the meantime, you can try what I have done which is give instructions on how long an order will take when they order. It doesn’t happen often now that I have specified the delivery times and max words per package but even when it does, it has never been an issue for them to increase it.

Yeah, thank you, I made an ‘instructional screenshot’ for gig multiples recently as I had another kind of problem, a buyer used the 24 hour delivery extra to order for 2x the words instead of 2x gig, told me in the instructions that it’s fine to deliver within the normal delivery time which was 3 days and only used the 24 hour option to get to the price for 2x the included words.
Well, as you know but he as a Buyer of course not necessarily, I still had to deliver within the 13 or so hours left after waking up to the order, or spend time on messaging and asking for an extension (with maybe consequences for secret rates and ranking ;)) and to risk it running late.
Well, that hopefully Dorstone happen often and I explained it to the buyer with a Screenshot of the multiple thing, but that other problem cost me 2 mutual cancellations and thus a good drop in cancellation rate already.
The thing here is that while for many of our suggestions there are pros and cons, but here I don’t really see any good reason for fiverr to not do it.
Well, determined to not let this go until it gets a fix or someone fiverry tells me it never will.

reply_text:
Yes, that’s the issue. You can offer additional words or write it in your description in bold and highlighted, but still if they want to buy multiples, they can, and you can’t really even say it’s their fault, they should know you can’t simply order 10K words in 1 day if the seller offers 1K with 1-day delivery, or whatever, because if the drop-downs are there, why shouldn’t they use them (some people just have no idea of what is possible to manually do in a day, others don’t care, or maybe think you work as a team, …) … as a seller, you can only fulfill the order, if even humanly possible, or cancel.
And since Fiverr most apparently doesn’t want us to cancel even if there’s an absolutely good reason to, since their cancellation policy change and level evaluation implementation, they should take care of such clear gaps in the system.
I don’t quite understand where the problem is there, either - the lower your level, the less multiples a buyer can click… so, it’s definitely possible technically to limit the multiples, that’s as if it is a punishment actually for having a higher level than it being one of the perks… being able to set our own number of multiples, that would be a perk.
Where’s the incentive for a buyer to order a faster delivery extra, too, if they can just order however many multiples they want to get a big amount of text done within a delivery time that only is meant for much less text. It doesn’t make any sense, no matter from which side I look at it. You’re at the mercy of buyers who are aware of how long something needs and sensible enough to contact you instead of simply clicking on what’s clickable, respectively you’re at risk of this system gap being exploited by those who’d do such on purpose.

reply_text:
janebarnaby:
I need this right now. Someone bought 3 days’ worth of work in gig multiples at 5 am my time, left the wrong type of document, and is now vast asleep. Due to the multiple problem, the delivery is still 24 hours. By the time I woke up, it was down to 19 and a half. By the time he’ll wake up, it’ll be down to ~12 hours…and that’s not a whole lotta time to do 3 days’ work.
Hi Jane! I’m sorry to know you’re going through this.
Sadly, you will find people blithely telling you to set Gig multiples instead of packages, but the truth is that this is the worst option for a large number of categories or sellers - especially for writers, translators and proofreaders.
For sellers like us who belong to the writing category, and corresponding subcategories, choosing to offer Gig multiples is asking for trouble, since our work time – and, hence, the delivery time - strictly depends on the amount of words we’re working with. So, unless you offer a very low word count (and I mean a really low word count), setting Gig multiples is never a good idea.
If my advice could be of any help, I would suggest you to consider offering packages. Try to set them in such a way that buyers will be discouraged to order your 1-day delivery package for files with a high word count.

janebarnaby:
I did use to have the 3-package set-up, but that basically came down to the exact same rate per word, just a bigger word count. Another regular user on the forums told me to abolish that, so hearing this is a bit confusing. Should I go back to the same tactic?
Yes, Jane. You should go back to offering packages unless you want to see yourself again in such a mess.
You can play with maximum word count, price, delivery time, and whatever other options Fiverr allows you, for each package. No three packages must be the same if you don’t want.
Also, on the edit mode, under “Pricing” and just below the packages, there’s an extra words option for each package (“Add Extra Services”). Set it in such a way that it will always be cheaper to choose the following package.

If only we could turn off gig multiples,

janebarnaby:
or turn off the ability to attach files… I have now added an extra Gig requirement asking if people have put the GDoc link in instead of another file, just to drive the point home in case they didn’t read the gig description, FAQ, or first requirement.
This is not something easy to solve. The problem here is that seldom buyers work with GDocs, so you will have to change the wording and really, really make it super clear that you don’t work with any other type of files.
For those who do work with GDocs, guide them into reading your FAQ where they will find the methodology, including the need of attaching the GDoc link. This, since most buyers don’t even bother to read all the gig description, including FAQ.

reply_text:
The issue here is that
the delivery time doesn’t increase with the amount of multiples someone orders/
sellers can’t set their own number of possible gig multiples.
At least one of this really should be in place, as simple logic tells; both would be ideal, then sellers could choose the optimal set-up for their offerings.
I’ve just had it again the other day, someone ordered 3x the basic gig which includes 24-hour delivery. The time should have simply gone up to 3 days in that case, with a banner that makes the customer aware of it before they actually order, for all I care, in case it’s not obvious to someone that 3x the words might take 3x the time.
The buyer in this case even wrote “it doesn’t have to be 1 day”, only it has, because of this thinking/programming flaw, or I’d have had to send a time extension request - which costs me additional time, also might count against us for all we know, and nerves, as I can’t know whether or not the buyer will see and accept the request on time, might need me to rearrange my schedule but I can’t while I don’t know if they’ll accept the request on time or not, …
The really obvious and simple solution to keep things as automated and quick as possible (which is goals for Fiverr, too, as we know) is that the delivery time multiplies in line with the ordered gig multiples.
If someone wants to order 3x the words of the basic 1-day delivery gig, they have to either choose the “next tier” which would be 5x the words and have a higher delivery time “built in”, or to contact the seller to ask whether they even can deliver 3x the amount of words the basic gig offers, at this time, if yes, fine, if no, the seller can offer a custom offer with 2 or 3 days, whatever is possible.
Or, very simple, let sellers set their own number for gig multiples, starting from 0, then they can set up their gig packages effectively and according to what they (can) offer, and such things can’t happen.
Sellers who just click a few buttons, or are super fast or offer such “small things” that can each be done in a minute or two, can then set the gig multiples to 10, 100, or 1000 for all I care, and those who actually need time to do their job, can set up their gigs so that they aren’t stuck between Scylla and Charybdis, when looking at their options when someone books too many multiples.
/rant over, but it’s still a suggestion. There is no logic in how it currently is; it should be at the least so that either the delivery time automatically increases with multiples, or that sellers can set their own gig multiple limit, ideally both.

reply_text:
The whole setup system, including extras, could need an overhaul, with the input of people who (try to) actively use it. There is also the related issue that if you want to offer some extra, the price for that extra will be billed only once and not according to how many multiples a buyer chooses, which also makes no sense. Say you offer writing an article of 1000 words and proofreading as an extra for $X, then if someone orders 2000 words and the proofreading extra, they’ll only pay the proofreading for 1000 words but you need to do it for 2000 words. No logic behind that.
Sellers are held back from offering more/faster/better if they have too little control over these things for no apparent reason and need to constantly think “oh I can only offer a small number of words in this gig, because what if someone orders more than I can do in x time” and so on.
Well, this forum category is for suggesting such ideas and supposedly is monitored. If you send ideas to support, they say “We’ve forwarded it to the relevant team” (which probably is the same team that monitors this category). It also makes more sense to have this forum category for that, so they won’t constantly get loads of suggestions for the same thing by lots of different people but can look through the suggestions and take on board what is feasible and disregard what is not.
It would be great, if the people who monitor this category could briefly comment on suggestions (at least on the ones that aren’t outrageous and make a lot of sense) and say “sorry, won’t/can’t happen (because)”, or “yeah, (on top of) our list, as soon as we can”, or something. Until then, I guess I’ll keep suggesting this…

thread_name: Gig Multiples for Packages - option to turn off/limit multiples needed
thread_text:
I had switched from the ‘normal’ 1 Gig thing to the Packages.
My packages offer, e. g. 100, 250 or 1000 words, but people can just use the gig multiple thing to up the words to several hundreds or thousands, while the delivery time stays the same,
and obviously I can only translate a certain number of words per day, no matter how long I work.
Please implement an option to limit the multiples, or at least the delivery time must go up with the number of multiples booked.
Being able to limit the bookable multiples I think would make the switch easier for a lot of people who are still not using packages too, it´s what kept me from switching earlier. I don´t want to have to cancel orders because people book more than I can do, and the simple option to turn off or limit the multiples would take care of that.
reply_text: Speak of the devil and he shall come… Someone ordered a gig multiple just now. Only 2x, thankfully. Should be more than manageable. A seller-imposed limit would be really nice, considering we can’t trust buyers.

thread_text:
I had switched from the ‘normal’ 1 Gig thing to the Packages.

reply_text:
Wow it’s disturbing that ordering that many multiples is even possible!
We can set how many orders we can have our queue, so why can’t we set how many multiples in our queue? It’s weird to me.
I also think there should be conditional logic, in other words, options for orders-in-process would vary depending on what we ordered/programmed into our gig. Like if 3 multiples were selected, the “Express Delivery” option would be blurred out – or whatever we’d programmed. There are plenty of circumstances that make this necessary.

:YES
:NO
10
voters
Show results

reply_text:
Agreed.
I barely ever look at Buyer Requests as there are almost no Danish translation requests with a reasonable budget, but it is clear that it needs an upgrade.
For me, it would really be helpful if there was a subcategory for each language under the ‘Translation’ category. I know I can search for ‘Danish,’ but do I really have to see all those requests that are of no relevance to me every time I open up Buyer Requests?
And, of course, it would be nice to be able to filter by budget.

thread_name: POLL: IF a seller has copied a gig description and/or image from another seller, BAN THEM
thread_text:
Any seller who copies either the description or image from someone else’s gig should be banned. They do not have the ability to either make their own gigs, or to know how fiverr works.
I’m not sure why fiverr keeps sellers who copy other people’s gigs. Shouldn’t they be banned? They aren’t going to be good sellers.
I came to this conclusion since it’s much too common an occurance.
Sellers who copy another seller’s gig should be banned
Sellers who copy another sellers gig should NOT be banned

Any seller who copies either the description or image from someone else’s gig should be banned. They do not have the ability to either make their own gigs, or to know how fiverr works.
I’m not sure why fiverr keeps sellers who copy other people’s gigs. Shouldn’t they be banned? They aren’t going to be good sellers.
I came to this conclusion since it’s much too common an occurance.
Sellers who copy another seller’s gig should be banned
Sellers who copy another sellers gig should NOT be banned
105
voters
Results will be shown on vote.

thread_name: Finally Gig analytics are back in timeline!
thread_text: After so many days of waiting Finally Fiverr has added the Gig Analysis. Thoug it’s not showing on Fiverr mobile app. Also it’s not fully done, as like the last time the “UP” and “DOWN” arrow is not showing even Fiverr wrote a note that “Your Gig analytics are back! View your impressions, clicks, and views. You’ll be able to access your complete analytics data soon” so that means the process is on going and may be sellers can controll the analyics also. Let’s see what happen…

Fedi
reply_text: Try clearing cookies/cache, or try a different browser.

thread_text:
Since yesterday the inbox is not shown in Browser. I only get the navigation and an empty page.
Is there a solution? Does anyone else have this problem?
Thanks in advance.
Fedi
reply_text: Drag out your window to make it wider. If it’s too narrow it removes some tabs from the menu.

thread_text:
I’ll occasionally click on the notification button and the list will include updates from months ago, instead of showing me the most recent activity. That throws me off at times when the pop up on my phone tells me someone left me a tip or review and when I go on my computer to take a look, those notifications aren’t even there. Refreshing the site tends to help, though.
Is anyone else having this issue?
reply_text:
@authoreva
You are not alone…

thread_text:
Hi, I hope all are doing very well.
I want to put forward my suggestion, that we should be allowed to add links of our portfolio in gig description. Currently there are many allowed like flickr, dailymotion, vimeo and much more.
Behance, Github, Stack Overflow, Dribble we can link these accounts to our profile, but links from these websites are not allowed to be added in gig description. Isn’t it Odd??
It should be allowed.
What you think???
reply_text:
No it’s not odd. The links you suggest would allow communication outside Fiverr, which is against the terms of service, here: https://www.fiverr.com/terms_of_service 1
.
Just a reminder: posting on the forum will not get you more sales.

reply_text: It’s not odd because people would use it to commit fraud and there are countless legitimate ways you can showcase your work here.

thread_name: Request for adding a More effective feature
frequent_posters: asshuu, catwriter, rana4944, hassannawaz0303, mashiurrahma875, pratikmder, mobimapeli, vibronx, themeexpress, tech_treon
thread_text:
I want this feature. Who is agree with this feature please vote.
If a buyer is going to place an order, he or she must first find the Terms and Conditions page for the service for which he or she is going to place an order. The order should be issued after agreeing to the terms and conditions, otherwise, he could not give the order.
This will have the advantage that the decision will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the seller. If the service provider violates its terms and conditions, the decision will be in favour of the buyer.
This will not be unfair to anyone. The seller will create the terms and conditions himself. Whether this option is met during service creation.
reply_text: That’s a great idea. So no one can violate terms and conditions. If they fiverr will take action

thread_name: Request for adding a More effective feature
frequent_posters: asshuu, catwriter, rana4944, hassannawaz0303, mashiurrahma875, pratikmder, mobimapeli, vibronx, themeexpress, tech_treon
thread_text:
I want this feature. Who is agree with this feature please vote.

reply_text:
Who is the ‘survivor’ in this case?
Your Terms and Conditions should be specified on your gig page, and buyers are already able to read those. Some of them choose not to, however, but they still agree to them all the same when they place an order.
We do not need a separate feature for this. It will not make buyers more likely to read your Terms and Conditions. The same buyers will still skip them.

thread_name: Why does the amount of money you have in your account decrease when you transfer to your bank?
frequent_posters: cheyennewriter, misscrystal, miiila, sajedulshawon1, fonthaunt, hritikkumar2580, cyaxrex, megan_grover
thread_text:
I ended up having $26 less sent to my account after looking at bank fees, Fiverr fees, etc. It says a certain amount in the top right hand corner and then my Earnings say something completely different. I’m really confused. Where is this missing money going? This is the second time this has happened to me.
Does anyone else have this problem?
reply_text:
The amount you can withdraw is shown in two places in the upper right corner of your earnings page.
Sometimes the two amounts are different for unknown reasons. Wait until the amounts match to withdraw the funds and there shouldn’t be this problem.
There is the small green number at the very top right, and the amount that says “available for withdrawal” below that in black.
That little “expected earnings” amount is something you can ignore. It is supposed to show what you will earn after the orders you have not yet delivered clear but for me it is not correct so I ignore that.
The “available for withdrawal” amount is what you will actually be withdrawing. Paypal takes out up to $1 each time you withdraw money to your Paypal account. I don’t know what amount Payoneer takes out.

reply_text:
Thank so much for the reply!
So the amount in green is just… Inaccurate sometimes? I’ve asked Fiverr twice about this and they never told me that. That’s so weird and dumb. I don’t know if my two amounts are reaaaaaally different because mine are in different currencies, but there’s a huge gap between the green and the black on my page.

They seem to not match at times because one will update faster, usually the little green one. The black one is the amount you will actually be able to withdraw.

thread_name: Why does the amount of money you have in your account decrease when you transfer to your bank?
frequent_posters: cheyennewriter, misscrystal, miiila, sajedulshawon1, fonthaunt, hritikkumar2580, cyaxrex, megan_grover
thread_text:
I ended up having $26 less sent to my account after looking at bank fees, Fiverr fees, etc. It says a certain amount in the top right hand corner and then my Earnings say something completely different. I’m really confused. Where is this missing money going? This is the second time this has happened to me.
Does anyone else have this problem?
reply_text:
If you are being paid via Payoneer or direct bank transfer via Payoneer, you are at the mercy of Payoneers, out of this world custom exchange rate. Try switching to Paypal as a withdrawal method.
I use Payoneer and this year, fees have become catastrophic. I can calculate how much I should be able to withdraw in Euros from an ATM, minus an extra 50 Euros in fees just in case, and still get a declined withdrawal request + a $1 Payoneer failed withdrawal charge.
This (I believe) is due to Payoneer holding all user funds in GBP but displaying account balance amounts as USD and later applying 2 sets of exchange rates as transactions are processed.

thread_name: Why does the amount of money you have in your account decrease when you transfer to your bank?
frequent_posters: cheyennewriter, misscrystal, miiila, sajedulshawon1, fonthaunt, hritikkumar2580, cyaxrex, megan_grover
thread_text:
I ended up having $26 less sent to my account after looking at bank fees, Fiverr fees, etc. It says a certain amount in the top right hand corner and then my Earnings say something completely different. I’m really confused. Where is this missing money going? This is the second time this has happened to me.
Does anyone else have this problem?
reply_text: Just to be sure you are looking at the right number - are you calculating what you should have after the Fiverr 20% commission and fees? For me, there is a number the client is charged (i.e. $10) and then the amount that I get in Fiverr (i.e. $8) and then when I withdraw PayPal takes its percentage so I’ll end up with $7+ out of a $10 service. The PayPal fees vary according to how much you have, so I always wait until I have at least $50-100 to withdraw and that way the $1 fee from PayPal has little sting.

Does anyone else have this problem?
reply_text:
If you’re not in the US and thus get the money into your bank account in a different currency than US$, you’ll pay conversion fees too.
For PayPal, that means, you don’t just pay $1 for the money to move from your Fiverr to your PayPal account but another 2,5% (for my country, at least, it was 2,5% when I last looked) for the currency conversion. I don’t know what Payoneer takes, but they certainly don’t do it for nothing either.
So, if I have, for instance, a $100 order, this happens: -20 % (Fiverr seller fee), -$1 (from Fiverr account to PayPal account), -2.5 % (from PayPal account to bank account):
$100 > $80 > $79 > $77.03 / €67,68

thread_name: How many times i can extend delivery with mutual agreement?
thread_text: i have a buyer with whom i will be working on 90 days big project but i have only option of 30 days ,even buyer agreed to do extension since it needs 90days i just want to confirm how many times it is possible to extend delivery time? i checked this answer on forum but there is a similar doubt one guy asked but that wasn’t clarified so i posted new one.
reply_text:
You can extend it indefinitely, but the question is why would it be worth it.
You only get paid on order completion. Do you want to wait 90 days + 14 days (for the clearance) to get paid? What if there’s a problem with the order, and you end up wasting 3 months for nothing?

thread_text:
Its happens many times that buyer though satisfied don’t leave a review for the services they have bought. As a seller I know how important it is to get a review especially when you are a No Level Seller. Due to some really strict Fiverr TOS you can’t ask your buyer to rate their experience (some long debate for this) I think it should be made compulsory for both buyers as well as sellers once an order is marked completed to give a review/rating of their experience with one another either bad,satisfactory or excellent
Let me know your opinions below
reply_text:
No. We do not need mandatory reviews. You already got paid for your services. Buyers are not obligated to leave you a review.
Do you always leave a review for Amazon sellers? Reviews are important to them too.

thread_text:

Besides, you should be happy that Fiverr buyers are much more likely to leave reviews than buyers on other platforms online. My Rated Orders % is 53%, and I know that this is lower than what many other sellers here have (Maybe that is because I have never even alluded to reviews or feedback when I deliver, as I strictly adhere to the ToS).
I think 53% is extremely high compared to other online selling platforms. I will use the example of Steam as I sell games on there and know the platform well. Reviews are extremely important on Steam, almost as much as on Fiverr. But, on Steam, you will be lucky if 0.2% of your buyers leave a review. So, I think you should be very thankful that a large percentage of Fiverr buyers take time out of their day to leave a review for you.
It is a privilege to receive a review, not a right.

reply_text:
I see where you’re coming from. It’s always a bit disappointing when you’re trying to promote your new Gig, and for some reason your first client doesn’t leave a review (despite being satisfied).
However, it’s good to keep in mind that some buyers simply don’t like to leave reviews. They might be 100% satisfied with your work, but it’s just not in their habits to leave feedback. This could be for many different reasons. Some customer value their privacy and don’t want other people to see their purchases. Some other clients are just too busy and don’t want to “waste time”. Others simply forget about it. Who knows?
The thing is, if reviews were compulsory, a considerable proportion of customer would be less willing to buy on Fiverr.

reply_text:
parvesislam_efn:
i’m agree with you it also happened with me. I don’t think money is everything. I’m doing a lot of hard work for his job but he didn’t give me review.How do I know if he is satisfied with my work?I will be motivated by one of his reviews. Isn’t that so?
Usually, customers who are satisfied but don’t want to leave a review, will simply say that they are, or, if they aren’t the kind that likes to talk much, they’ll come and buy again. For example, I have a regular customer since years, who used to leave reviews but eventually stopped, maybe he just got bored of writing the same over and over again, who knows, it’s fine, though, he still thanks me for my good work in chat, and keeps coming back, I know he’s happy.
Sure, it would be even better for me if he not just came back to order constantly but still left a review every time he orders, but well, it’s not worth dwelling on. Some people keep reviewing, every single order, and that’s great, often, I think it’s people who know themselves just how important reviews are because they have some kind of business that also thrives with reviews.
If you’re in a niche where repeat and regular customers are a rarer species, I guess it can be more difficult. However, most buyers certainly take advantage of being able to check out seller reviews themselves and thus are aware that it’s generally a good idea to leave a review, because that’s what enables them as well to pick a seller based on their reviews, so if they don’t leave a review, they probably have a reason for it.
It might just be that they don’t even want to waste a few seconds of their life on the mundane task of typing a review, it might be that they don’t want to “expose” their not that great English in public, or that they are a reseller, or don’t want anyone to know that their company buys on Fiverr, or even that they weren’t blown away by your work but don’t want to harm your rating stats by marring it with a 3* or whatever rating.
In any case, buyers who really like your work, probably will say so, if in a review, or in chat, or by buying again, and it would be a really weird move by Fiverr to try and start to force buyers to leave reviews.

thread_text:
Its happens many times that buyer though satisfied don’t leave a review for the services they have bought. As a seller I know how important it is to get a review especially when you are a No Level Seller. Due to some really strict Fiverr TOS you can’t ask your buyer to rate their experience (some long debate for this) I think it should be made compulsory for both buyers as well as sellers once an order is marked completed to give a review/rating of their experience with one another either bad,satisfactory or excellent
Let me know your opinions below

reply_text:
So you think I am unprofessional?
I have had many wonderful experiences with sellers on Fiverr, but around Summer 2019 I started to run into a lot of sellers (some new sellers, some with over 100 reviews) who promised many beautiful things during the initial conversation. Then they started extending the order deadline (which is okay), but when they couldn’t keep the new deadline either, they started to make more excuses. Stringing me along for as long as they could, when they very well knew that they did not have the skills necessary to complete the job. Some of them even managed to keep this going for months, as I am very naive sometimes and likely to believe a person has good intentions rather than malicious ones. It annoyed me greatly that I wasted so much time during those months that I stopped spending money on Fiverr for a long time.
So, yes, I have started to find sellers on the forum instead. Sellers who post competently on the forum generally take their gigs more seriously, and, therefore, they are more likely to know what they are doing and deliver what they promise.
Large companies such as McDonald’s, Sony, Google, and so on are constantly judged by what they post on social media. And, guess what: So are you as a seller on Fiverr! You are your own brand!

No. This is totally a terrible idea.
Marketplace doesn’t work this way and will never be. This will just chase any potential clients away from the platform.
You paid for movie, do you have any obligation to leave review?
You paid for meal at restaurants, do you have any obligation to leave review?
You bought things in Amazaon, ebay etc, do you have any obligation to leave review?
You fly on airplanes, do you have any obligation to leave review?
The point is, everything you pay doesn’t obliged you to leave review. I paid for the service. I don’t paid to leave reviews.
This is free marketplace. Not communism or dictatorship marketplace.

thread_name: My friend made 2 accounts and now they are ban
thread_text: My friend made 2 accounts for himself and his younger brother. He didn’t knew about the multiple account rule Fiverr has, So now he wants to ask what should he do? Will he now never be able to make new accounts on fiverr?
reply_text:
Your friend agreed that they read the Fiverr Terms of Service (TOS) when they opened their first account.
The TOS clearly states that only one account is allowed.
I suggest that your friend reads the terms of service before doing anything else. Then, when they’ve read them, they should contact CS and talk to them about whether or not they can open a new account.

thread_text:
I have a client whose work I have finished a couple of days ago. I message him two times in the last couple of days to provide feedback, my message was:
"Hello, hopefully, this will find you all well. I hope you have liked the work, if this is so, please provide your valuable feedback. "
Should I remind him third-time to provide his valuable feedback or it would go against Fiverr policies?
Please guide.
reply_text:
You should not have done it the first time either. It can lead to a warning eventually.
“Do not manipulate buyers to provide positive feedback.”
From:
https://sellers.fiverr.com/en/article/feedback 2

thread_name: Buyer Details when Submitting Buyer Request
thread_text:
I or most of the sellers have to sent buyer requests to get orders. But you may notice that there is a lot of fake job post. It’s very annoying to me or you always.
We can’t see the username of the buyer when sending the request. I know it’s available on the mobile app. But if we want to write it in the browser, it will take a few times. If we can see a short overview of the buyer before sending the request that will be great. I am really interested to know what do you think about this matter. Please share your valuable opinion. Thank you!
reply_text:
jsrrony:
But you may notice that there is a lot of fake job post.
How do you know that they are “fake job posts”?
jsrrony:
If we can see a short overview of the buyer before sending the request that will be great.
Fiverr keeps buyer ID names in the BR section private, so that sellers don’t spam those buyers with messages. You don’t need to know a buyer’s information in order to send them an offer. If you want to work with a buyer in BR, you will have to send them an offer in the buyer’s request section, and then wait for them to respond – if they choose to respond to your offer.
Spamming users is a serious offense on Fiverr, and Fiverr has deleted accounts because of it.

thread_name: I’m loosing my “Order completion” every day by 1 percent… And customer servise don’t reply me
thread_text:
Hello to everybody!
This story is really strange for me. Already one year I work with fiverr and all was good, I have 2 level and not bad rating. But in the last time many strange things are happening… Two days ago one buyer placed order by mistake (she just didn’t read my requirements). Okay, no problem, this is usual problem here. Just for interesting I wrote to customer center in order to resolve this problem, maybe without loosing my “order completion” rating. But they didn’t answer me. We con buyer decided to do mutual cancellation (“buyer mistake”). Of course, I lost my rating. I wrote to customer service again in order to they will explain me this thing, but they still didn’t answer me. And more then that, every day after this cancellation I’m loosing my “order completion” by 1 percent!! I already have one cancellation before, so after present cancellation I was have 92%. But today already 90! And I really don’t understand, what happening! I’m very frustrated. Maybe here somebody will respond me…
By the way, already some time I have red indicator of “unread messages”, but I don’t have unread messages! And when I move cursor to “messages” topic this indicator is disappearing. But, after update the page - appears again. Bugs, bugs and more bugs! And no reply from customer center!
PS, I’m really sorry for any users here! I mixed up “respond rate” with “order completion”!
reply_text:
It can take up to 10 days for CS to respond at the moment.
Your Response Rate and your Order Completion Rate are calculated over the course of the last 60 days. So, as time passes, your old messages and orders will become older than 60 days, and hence they will no longer be included in your Response Rate and Order Completion Rate. Thus, you might experience that your Response Rate and Order Completion Rate will decrease without you receiving new messages or orders.
The only way to fix this is by completing more orders and responding to more messages.

reply_text: Yes, if you received two messages in total: one message 60 days ago that you didn’t respond to, and a message a day ago that you did respond to, your Response Rate will be 50%. The day after, your Response Rate will be 100% as the first message is now 61 days old, and thus no longer valid in this context.

reply_text:
Check how many orders you have in last 60 days and how many are cancelled? You are saying 90 percent. So if you had 50 orders coming in last 60 days, you must have 5 orders cancelled otherwise it might be bug. But if you had 20 orders in last 60 days, you can’t have more than 2 cancellations.
Response rate also works same way.

reply_text: Because some of your completed orders have also become older than 60 days. Therefore, your cancelled orders due May 30 and July 15 will be a larger % of your total completed orders during the last 60 days.

reply_text:
If you mean that you had 19 orders (17 completed orders + 2 cancellation) then your Order Completion Rate is calculated like this:
2/19*100 = 10.53
100-10.53 = 89.47%

thread_name: 0 day delivery? This has to be a glitch
thread_text:
Recently, I stumbled upon a gig which offered 0 day delivery for the extra charge of “$0”. Has anyone else seen this before? Also, would the order be marked late right away if the countdown glitched as well?
?|690x200 5
reply_text:
I that’s not a glitch, +0 day delivery means not additional day is needed.
+0 means no price will be charge even if you use the express delivery.
It will be long to explain, you can try creating a gig, and you will understand it
